reviews.author: 184k041
reviews.comment_content:
Some basic marketing concepts (some you may have heard before too)
-3C (Company and SWOT, Customer, Competitor)
-Marketing Research
-STP (Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning)
-4P (Price, Product, Place, Promotion)

Mostly concepts, except for one topic that requires little calculations on breakeven)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sophie is always energetic in class. Although she is from Beijing, her English is similar to the Hong Kong accent (she can speak some Cantonese as well), except for some specific words like pronouncing "very" as "wary" and "segmentation" as "segamentation".
The PowerPoints are easy to understand, and she always read the content on the PowerPoint during classes and add a few explanations. The teaching is quite good, it would be even better if Sophie let more introverts speak during class, as everyone wants to get a higher participation score so you might not be chosen to talk.
reviews.comment_grading:
-Best 2 quizzes from 3 quizzes of 25 mc questions (25% each)
-Group Project Report (27%)
-Group Presentation (15%)
-Group Exercise (5%)
-Research Credit (3%)
-Individual Class Participation (+/-10%) (including attendance and answering/asking questions, only if Sophie let you talk of course)

The group is formed of 5 students but the presentation requires only 3 students at most so I don't know how Sophie grades the other students. The Group Exercise and Individual Class Participation are quite subjective so I don't consider the grading system a fair one, as you get a higher score if Sophie remembers you. (P.s. she remembers a unique name by the first lesson just because it is not common, and she calls that student to answer questions quite frequently)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite fair as there are 3 quizzes so there was no final exam, there were also a presentation and report. The group project is to make the plan and analysis including 3C, STP, 4P, etc to explain a certain product/service that you are planning to sell/provide. The workload is not high for this part but the sad thing is that the time you spend on the project does not reflect on how Sophie is satisfied with the product/service.

reviews.author: hehehe6
reviews.comment_content:
3Cs (consumer, company, competitor)
STP (segmentation, targeting, positioning)
4Ps (product, price, place, promotion)
Platform strategy

The content overall is good. Everything is simple to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
June was super sweet and helpful when I asked questions.
Her slides are very organized, so it's easy to review the content yourself before the quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading:
quizzes 25% + 25% (best 2 out of 3 count towards the grade)
case assignment 5%
final project report 22%
final project presentation15%
group class participation 5%
research credit 3%
individual class participation +/-10%

For the final project presentation, there wasn't a group that is particularly the best or the worst so I think everyone would have gotten a similar score for that. So if you want to differentiate yourself, try to participate during class by asking questions or answering June's questions. There's no harm since this is the extra credit part of the class.
I had to take attendance in every class, but I'm not sure how that goes toward the grades.
reviews.comment_workload: Most of the workload comes from the project. I think the amount of work really depends on who you have in the group. June randomly makes groups and my group had some freeriders. At the end, I ended up doing most of the work.

reviews.author: JT168
reviews.title: June is a nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
Covers an overview of the marketing strategy
3C (Consumer, Company, Competition)
STP (Segmentation, Positioning, and Segmentation)
4P (Price, Product, Place, Promotion)

All the contents are simple to understand except for some of the calculations in the price discrimination part and value for information.
reviews.comment_teaching:
June teaches the concepts clearly and her ppt slides are well organized.

She tried her best to let us answer questions to get parti although the lecture time is tight.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes (3 Quizzes choose best 2) 25% + 25%
Case Assignment (credited by submission) 5%
Final Project Report 22%
Final Project Presentation  15%
Group Class Participation   5%
Research Credit 3%
Individual Class Participation +/-10%                                 

For Quizzes,
Quiz 1       Mean: 73/100       High:96   
Quiz 2       Mean: 72/100       High:92   
Quiz 3       Mean: 75/100       High:100

As you see, when calculating the scores, the lowest grade would be dropped so no worries if you have one quiz below the mean.
Try to study the lecture notes in as much detail because some of the questions in the quiz asked for details such as the examples in the notes. Also, study the sample quiz questions as some similar questions appear in the actual quiz.

The project report and present score didn't release.

For individual parti, I speak up every lesson and June remembers me. I think I get a high score for parti. One very important reminder is that not only answering questions can get a score, but asking questions and speaking out your comments are also positively contributing to the class and could get scores according to the syllabus.

In my opinion, the scores for group projects and quizzes are similar among all students. When graded by curve, what makes your score stand out would be the parti score as you can get 10 more scores than others if you speak up actively.

The grading is super lenient. I was expecting an A-, but got an A eventually.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is as follows.
For the research credit, I have to complete 3 sections of research, one hour each.
For the two case assignments, I spent 1 hour each.
For the project, ppt, script, and report have to be made. The workload was not much as there are so many ppl(8 people) in a group that the workload could be shared.
Overall, the workload is moderate.

reviews.author: KUSTS
reviews.comment_content:
Marketing process
3Cs
Marketing Research
STP
4Ps
Easy course content, but boring

two of my quizzes are reaching UQ and one is slightly higher than mean

research credit full
for parti, i spoke almost every lesson and sofie remember me
final grade: A

Three quizzes in total but it's non-accumulative, so thats fair
the biggest workload is the project, but as long as your teammates are not free rider, you wont have a high workload
in general, i think the workload of the course is ok, quite light

reviews.author: H1n
reviews.title: Sophie is good
reviews.comment_content:
- Marketing process
- 3Cs (Company, Competition, Consumers)
- Marketing Research
- STP (Segmentation, targeting and positioning)
- 4Ps (Product, Pricing, Place, Promotion)
reviews.comment_teaching: Sophie is nice and she always try her best to give us a 5-minute break each lecture. Her teaching is easy to understand and engaging, and the pace is just right.
reviews.comment_grading:
- 2 quizzes out of 3 (25% each)
- final project report [group] (27%)
- final project presentation [group] (15%)
- group exercise (5%)
- reserach credit (3%)
- individual class participation (+/- 10%)

The grading is quite good.
quiz 1 20/25 (mean 14.8 high 22)
quiz 2 24/25 (mean 16.4 high 24)
quiz 3 19/25 (mean 18.2 high 24)
Final project : nothing released
Participation: I attended every lecture and Sophie do remember my name without name tag
--> final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
The 3 quizzes are rather easy and solely based on the material taught in lectures (some not included in the lecture ppt provided on Canvas), so the workload is light.

There's also 3 research credit needed, but it's easy so just remember to check the system and go participate them right away.

For the group project and report, it depends on the groupmate you met (it's randomly assigned). The presentation only require max 3 people from the group to present (one group shd have 6+ ppl), and there're plenty time for preparing the report.

The report is 10-page limited and Sophie provides sample from previous classes she taught on Canvas, so it's not so hard to finish it neatly.

Btw don't worry there's peer evaluation form right from the start of lectures, so just report the freerider(s) right away if needed unfortunately.

reviews.author: christywts
reviews.title: Good professor!
reviews.comment_content: Introductory course to marketing. It teaches some basic concept,  which is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is nice and willing to answer students' questions. She explains concepts in details. Her lessons are interesting with good atmosphere.
reviews.comment_grading: She gives good grades. For quizzes, you need to revise and try to remember the content of textbook. If you would like to get better grades, remember to answer questions actively.
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable workload. No final exam. 3 quizzes and participation in class and group activities. 1 group project which requires written marketing plan and presentation.

reviews.author: lhmchoi
reviews.title: Unsatisfactory teaching
reviews.comment_content: The course is supposed to teach about marketing techniques, and I honestly could say a learned quite a bit however you are expected to buy a huge textbook and read through it yourself since the powerpoint slides and her lectures are really brief and not in-depth enough for you to get a high score. The final project also consisted of a groupwork where your group would write up a marketing project for a company, and present it. However, the course did not nearly prepare us enough for the task, and in fact all the topics in the later ends of the course end up rushed, with the last few not even discussed more than 30 minutes each. Attendance is required and part of a grade, she also encourages you to speak up during class and be proactive as it gives u an extra +/- 10% grade on ur final mark.
reviews.comment_teaching: Unfocused teaching, Whilst Prof Kim has decent english and teaching skills, she only delves into the surface layer of material and expects you to dive in-depth on your own into the textbook, not to mention she always suddenly rants about psychology in the middle of the class that take up large amounts of time. Also, if you write to her with questions about any topic or question, she will not respond instead asking you to figure it out for yourself. Overrall, unsatisfactory performance. The TAs weren't really involved in teaching so nothing to say about them.
reviews.comment_grading:
One of the worst grading I've ever seen.

Quiz 1 and 2 = 50%
Final project Report = 25%
Final project Presentation = 15%
In class exercises(group)  = 12%
Research Participation = 3%
Individual class participation = +/- 10%

I got a near perfect score on my quizzes, was really proactive in class and finished the researches, however I did not get the best groupmates for the final project and in class exercises, so I got slightly below mean for those. In the end I only got a B, which was not what I was expecting for getting 100% on quiz 2.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy, the required textbook is huge, every lesson you had a class assignment to finish and submit 30mins after class ends, fortunately most people ignore her lectures and just do it during class. Final project takes up huge amounts of time, whilst quizzes require quite a bit of revision.

reviews.author: Jasminebus
reviews.title: Super interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
L1: Course Introduction + What is the purpose of Marketing?
Managing Marketing Information + Consumer Markets and Consumer Buyer Behavior (Part A)
L2: Managing Marketing Information + Consumer Markets and Consumer Buyer Behavior (Part A)
L3: Consumer Markets and Consumer Buyer Behavior (Part B)
L4: Marketing Strategy: Segmenting, Targeting & Positioning (STP) (Part A)
Marketing Strategy: Segmenting, Targeting & Positioning (STP) (Part B)
L5: Marketing Strategy: Segmenting,
Targeting & Positioning (STP) (Part B) Marketing Strategy: Segmenting, Targeting & Positioning (STP) (Part C)
L6: Product: Branding Strategy (Part B)
Pricing Concept: Understanding and Capturing Customer Value + Marketing Channels
L7: The 4th P: Promotion (Part A)
L8: The 4th P: Promotion (Part B) + In-class activity
L9: Project Teamwork Session + Guest Lecture by Kuo-Hi Lee
L10: Marketing Plan Oral Presentation
L11: Final Quiz
reviews.comment_teaching: I LOVE CORAL!!! She is the best teacher I ever met at HKUST. She is knowledgeable in marketing theories with profound experience working as a marketing strategist. Additionally, she has a strong network in the marketing field, therefore, she arrange two guest lectures though the time is very limited during the summer semester. I really enjoy those guest lectures It is an eye-opening course. DON'T MISS IT IF YOU LOVE MARKETING.
reviews.comment_grading:
I did not expect a good grade, so I am satisfied with my final grading (though it may not be an acceptable grade for many business students in UST haha)
My grade: B
I really learn a lot in this course and my classmate are so talented, therefore I accept this result.
reviews.comment_workload: You always struggle with the workload issue while taking a course during the summer semesters. This course is packed (same as other courses in the summer sem), especially during the last two weeks. All the deadlines for the written report, presentation, and short essay are in the same week. And you also have to prepare for the final exam.

reviews.author: Hosl_michelle
reviews.title: Communication is key
reviews.comment_content:
General marketing concepts:
3C: customer, competitor and company
STP: Segmenting, Targeting and Positioning
4P's: Price, Product, Promotion, Place

The entire course is basically about planing for a marketing campaign and the fundamental concepts that helps understand your target customers.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Coral's classes are super fun and interactive. One thing i liked about her teaching is that she loves to share with us her work experiences and the specific projects that she had worked on which is very insightful and interesting. She also tends to invite guest speakers at the end of the semester which again makes the class more fun as we get to interact with industry professionals.

As mentioned by others, Coral does have a bit of an accent, but as a local student I think it is fine and I got used to it after a few lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 30% (commercial ads will be played during the exam and students are required to evaluate them using concepts taught in class)
Marketing plan (group project) 20%
Peer evaluation 12%
Class Participation
- in-class participation 15%
- 2 topic essays of 200 words 20%
research credit 3% (3 marketing experiments, can register different sessions to fit your schedule)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fine, a lot of the course content is common sense and are easy to understand and remember, final exam should be manageable as long as you pay some attention in class and know the slides (*including the attached youtube videos examples).

The project however can be quick tricky, it could be slightly different each semester, mine is to create a marketing plan for a business to sell their products to ust staff and students. I would say make sure to communicate with Coral, by which I mean talking to her after class or emailing her from time to time to update her about your progress and to get her opinions on your work. Coral is super generous about providing comments and is super nice to students who approach her.

Class participation matters a lot in this class. Basically same as every other courses in ust that includes class participation in grading. Coral gives a lot of opportunities for people to answer and to earn their scores. It can be sometimes stressful speaking in front of the class, but whether you are a local student or not, the whole purpose of university education is to train you for workplace interaction. If you find speaking in a class where the teacher's duty is to help you learn unbearable, you might as well consider another career direction.

reviews.author: Apple5682
reviews.comment_content: It gives an overview of what is marketing. The content is organized and useful in daily life. You will have a better understanding of what a company do for marketing. Different marketing stradegy are mentioned in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: She prepared some advertisment for demonstration and elaboration. However, she was quit strict and rude to students who asked or answered her questions.
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading. 90%--A range, 80%--B range,70%--C range. There were two quizzes and both are MC questions. The mean was quite high. So be careful to each question.
reviews.comment_workload: There was no assignment. The only thing to work on was the group project. The groupmate was randomly assigned in lesson.

reviews.author: climbclimb
reviews.title: DROP HER CLASS!
reviews.comment_content: Content is straight forward, which includes concepts of 3Cs, STP, 4Ps. Nothing special with the content
reviews.comment_teaching: She is mean af. When someone is presenting, she just keep rolling her eyes and never appreciates. Idk what's going on with her and her mood really fluctuates. Never ask dumb questions in classes, as you will definitely be scolded.
reviews.comment_grading: I got B at last, with extremely great effort. As she uses absolute grading, you need to score at least 84% for a B. However her quizzes are full of traps and careless mistakes will lead to a drop of subgrade. She also gives harsh comments regarding your project and the highest mark for report and presentation is 88/100 = B+? Never reg her class. And I got no bonus mark for in-class participation, even I often answer questions frequently and those answers are correct.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is suitable for an intro course I guess. You need to think of a whole marketing plan yourself, and the quiz is not a heavy workload, but to secure high marks, you need to revise thoroughly.

reviews.author: Smurfing in UST
reviews.title: A voice from a B-range student
reviews.comment_content:
Basic stuff about marketing: 3Cs, STP, 4Ps.
3Cs: Company, customer, competitor
STP: Segmenting, targeting, positioning and differentiation
4Ps: Product, promotion, price, place
Others like consumer behaviour, market research, ethics...

Not boring, if you like it. If you found this course boring, you should not select MARK major.
reviews.comment_teaching: Amy teaches quite well. Her lectures are not boring at all. Also, she is interactive. She will ask a lot of questions in the lectures (you can answer them to get participation credits). If you have questions, she will also address them. A good professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
All people are saying she gives good grades. True, but the competiton is severe. You will fall into B-range if you fail any component is this course.

3 quizzes, best 2 counted. 30% (22/25 & 19/25)
Case analysis. 10%. (10/10)
Marketing plan. 25%. (17/25, lowest in the section)
Class participation. 15%. (not disclosed, I guess 6/15, each answer/ question +1, so speak 15 times throughout the lecture to get full)
In-class activity. 17%. (4/6, 20/20 & 6/6)
Research participation. 3%. (Being a lab-rat for the faculty, 3/3)

Final grade: B
Conclusion: Do every part well and participate in the lecture actively. 15 times to get full credits.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload basically comes from the marketing plan. Your team will hold many meetings to discuss and work on the written report and the presentation. The marketing plan is VERY IMPORTANT in this course so you should spend much time on it. Don't be lazy.

3 quizzes in total. Non-cumulative. So you don't need to spend too much time studying.

reviews.author: j.2315_12
reviews.comment_teaching: Amy's a cool professor and nice to talk with.  You have to compete with others to answer questions to gain participation but Amy does try to find someone who haven't answered any questions so more people get the chance to answer sth.
reviews.comment_grading: Amy has a nice grading tbh. Just pay effort on the quizzes, answer sth and don't screw up in your project your grade shouldn't be bad.
reviews.comment_workload: There is but generally not huge. The hugest part has to be the group project with your teammates but they can share the work with you, especially if you have like 6 people in a group. Quizzes' preparation is not time-consuming and can gain a fair grade without being super diligent.

reviews.comment_content:
The content of the course was quite easy. It was mainly divided into:
3C: customer, competitor and company
STP: Segmenting, Targeting and Positioning
4P's: Price, Product, Promotion, Place
It's quite general and she didn't really focus on the content in the textbook. Most of her lectures were discussions in class about branding campaigns, what companies can do better, etc.

You will also need to participate in 3 research studies to get research credits (3% of the grade).
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is a very funny and engaging professor and encourages everyone to participate as much as possible in class even if you don't really know much about the topic. She makes the course content very applicable by using many case studies and even current marketing campaigns that are taking place. Overall, loved her teaching style.
She also brought in guest speakers to talk about their own experiences for 2 of the 4P's: promotion and product which helped me apply the concepts she taught in class a bit more.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz: 30%
Group Project (Creating a marketing plan): 20%
Peer Evaluation: 12%
Class Participation: 35
- In-class participation: 15%
- 2 Topic essays of 200 words: 20%
Research Credit: 3%

PARTICIPATE at least once every class. Also, try and find good groupmates because she cares the most about the marketing plan. The group project includes a presentation and a report so you spend a majority of time working on that.

The quiz was pretty easy, just pay attention in class and go through the textbook once. She doesn't care too much about the quiz so the questions are pretty straightforward.

You'll also need to write 2 essays about anything that she teaches - it's very flexible and pretty light workload bcs it's just 200 words.

She doesn't release any grades except for the essays. I got 3 in both and participated in most of the classes and got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too bad, the course mainly requires participation and working on the marketing plan.
She gives time in class to work on the group project so you won't need to spend too much time outside class on it.
Since there was no midterm and the final was a short quiz, it wasn't a demanding course. Just try to pay attention in class because you'll form your marketing plan based on everything she teaches.

reviews.author: Bon*2

Cover basic marketing framework

Quite interesting and easy to understand
Some real-life examples and social experiments are given in the lecture to clarify the concepts

She also tries to engage as many students as she can by asking lots of questions and waiting until there is no one raising a hand. RMB to grab your chance to answer earlier so that you can have more points or examples to mention. If you are not chosen to answer the question, don't worry! She usually asks 1-3 questions in her lecture but the questions become less and less near the end of the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite good. I got an A.
1) Quizzes (individual work) 25% each
quiz 2 &3 84/100
You will need to take 3 quizzes in total. It will directly pick the best 2 quizzes for the grade.
2) Final Project Report (group work)             27%
3) Final Project Presentation (group work)                         15%
4) Group Exercise (group work) 5%
5) Research Credit (individual work)                                                                         3%

reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very light if you got good groupmates. You just need to understand the concepts clearly by referring to the ppt before quizzes. It will contain some questions about examples mentioned and questions asked in class so it's better to jot down the results and answers. Basically, the quizzes won't clash with the midterms and there is no final in this course, so you just need to finish your group report at last and you can forget about this course.
You just need to attend 3 research experiments to earn the research credits. Just reg it earlier so that you could manage your time better.

RMB to answer questions in the class so as to earn as much class parti as you can. Be careful that the class participation could be more than 10% if you are really active so just try to answer 1 question in every lesson to make June remember your face.

reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.author: bbkiller
reviews.title: easy to get B but hard to get an A
reviews.comment_content:
Grading:
The grade components and the associated weights are as follow:
1) Quizzes (individual work) 25% each
2) Final Project Report (group work)             27%
3) Final Project Presentation (group work)                         15%
4) Group Exercise (group work) 5%
5) Research Credit (individual work)                                                                         3%
6) Individual Class Participation (individual work)                                           +/- 10%
This course is designed to introduce you to the concepts and skills essential in marketing strategy.
Marketing strategy involves two basic sets of activities. The first set starts with identifying
consumer needs and ends with positioning a product or service to satisfy those needs and
differentiate it from competition. In between, there is rigorous analysis of the customer, the
competition, the environment, and the company‚Äôs own capabilities. The second set of activities
revolves around the ‚Äúmarketing mix‚Äù, commonly referred to as the 4 P‚Äôs (product, placement, price
and promotion). Marketing mix activities include letting the consumer know about the product in an
attention-getting, convincing and motivating way, getting it to the consumer through the best
combination of distribution channels, pricing it effectively, and offering incentives to try, purchase,
and re-purchase.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Great, not boring, fast-paced, flexible.

reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 13/15 (mean: ~11; highest: 15)
Quiz 2: 27/30 (mean: ~21; highest: 30)
Quiz 3: 13/25 (mean: ~12; highest: 19)
Final report project: 17/17
Final project presentation: 8/10
Research credit: 3/3
Participation: ~2/5

Final grade: A (~86%)
FYI:  A+ cutoff is 87%. Only a few got it tho.
The grading is fair and transparent I suppose.
The quizzes are all MCs and you will only be given full marks for that question if you choose all the correct answer(s) (you can select multiple answers) which can be quite tricky. Wenbo said spending 1 hour for each quiz is enough but I highly doubt that. Sorting out the materials definitely takes time and helpful as they are open-book quizzes. There are samples and textbook examples for you to take as an extremely helpful reference for the report. Should have participated in class more for sure.

reviews.comment_teaching: Wenbo claimed himself to be very "lenient" in the first class. He would try to give out as many "A"s as he can. reviews.comment_grading:
50% Quizzes with 25% each (Best 2 out of 3 counted)
37% Final Group Project Report (27% Report 10%)
3% Research Credit
10% In-Class Group Case Discussion
+/-10% Participation

There are 3 quizzes and the one with lowest score will be dropped. My advice to all of you is to get full mark in the first quiz as that is the easiest. After you get 100% in the first quiz, do not look forward to another 100% in the second or even the third one. They are much harder!!

The +/-10% participation is worthwhile to say something in class. You may not get full mark even though you participate every class like the extroverts do. But, you can get a decent participation score for participating every 2-3 lectures. The first few times of participation always help the most.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. For this course, you can expect the lightest workload in the university of stress and tension. Spending 1 hour before the day of quiz to go over the materials is good enough. No homework or assignment. For the project, it is pretty easy. No final exam!!!!

reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair.  It would be pretty important to find responsible group mates for the group project as it contributes to quite a big part to your overall course grade.  There is not much homework in this course.

reviews.author: matthew1130
reviews.comment_content:
3Cs, STP and 4Ps


TEACHING

Sophie is a really nice and friendly professor! Her English is good (although has a bit accent), and she delivers concept in a very clear way (e.g. give some real-life examples). Some in-class exercises really help to understand the concept. There are also consultation sessions for you to ask questions about your group project, and she will give you detailed comments. Before each quiz, she will provide revision sessions (very important).
Personally, I think she is one of the best professors I have ever met in UST!

GRADING

3 Quizzes (Best 2)  25%
Final Project Report  27%
Final Project Presentation  15%
Group Exercise  5%
Research Credit  3%
Individual Class Participation +/-10%

The grading is pretty fair, Personally, I get an A (Best 2 quizzes: 18/25, 20/25; Score of group project not released).

It is easy to get full marks in research credit and group exercises. For the individual class participation, it is really important to attend and raise your hand in every lecture so that Sophie will remember your name, and this counts a lot to your final grade.

Quizzes are not so difficult, they are all MC questions (will ask some questions about applying concepts in real world).
However, the options are quite ambiguous. Even after you finished the quizzes and check the notes, I will still not sure about your answer. As a result, no one get full marks in any of these quizzes. But if you pay attention in every lecture, you should have no problem with the quiz.
Since it is an online examination, it is close-book and pen is not allowed.

WORKLOAD

The workload is pretty low. There are no individual assignments. For the quizzes, if you pay attention in the lecture, it just cost you 1 day for revision (try to memorize all key concepts). The workload of group projects really depends on your teammate. But overall, the workload is still low for a 3 credit course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sophie is a nice professor. She is patient and she is willing to answer questions hold by students. Though she has a little bit of accent. It is already for you to get a good grade through attending her lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Quizzes (Best 2)  25%
Final Project Report  27%
Final Project Presentation  15%
Group Exercise  5%
Research Credit  3%
Individual Class Participation +/-10%

I get mean for quizzes but I am not sure about the marks of group project. I get B
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. You can revise the quiz 2 days before it starts. The project depends on whether you have good groupmates

reviews.author: BenWong
reviews.comment_content:
The content is around the daily life like IKEA.
In the class, the course talks about 4p: price, product, place and promotion 3c: company, consumer and competitor stp: segmentation, targeting and positioning.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His classes were quite fun ,and always talks some jokes and play videos.
He always used example to explain some strategies, so it is quite easy and clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Bad Bad Bad Bad Grade

He said that he would give good grade and a lot A grade. However, at the end, near all of people got C range. My 3 quizzes were also above mean but I still got C+ at the end
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was quite low and only had 3 quizzes but didn't have midterm and final exam.

reviews.author: You guess!
reviews.title: Reg him for sure!
reviews.comment_content:
Topics are quite easy to understand as this is the intro course only. 10 topics are stated in the syllabus but only the first seven are taught due to time limit.

Topics:
1. Introduction to Marketing Management
2. Marketing Environment Analysis
3. Managing Marketing Information
4. Consumer and Buyer Behavior.
5. Market Segmentation, Targeting, and Positioning
6. Product Strategies
7. Pricing Strategies
8. Distribution Strategies
9. Promotion Strategies
10. Marketing Ethics and Social Responsibility
reviews.comment_teaching:
His tone and accent are easy to follow and understand and his lesson is quite fun as he will play some videos and tell jokes. However, he was lagging behind the syllabus seriously but he would rather cutting off the syllabus than telling us to read textbook ourselves.

Ummmmm, to be honest, I didn't really pay much attention during the lesson (9am lesson is a hell for me), but still need to wake up for attendance and participation.

I was frustrated when the first quiz result released (10 marks below mean). But then I changed my revision style to watch the lecture recordings back before each quiz once only and it helps a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
SUPER GOOD GRADE!

My grade:
Quiz 1: 74.5/100 (mean: 82.1, max: 100)
Quiz 2: 90/100 (mean: 84.6, max: 100)
Quiz 3: 90/100 (mean: 81.5, max: 96.6)
*Choosing the best two quizzes out of three, each quiz count for 20%
Quizzes are 40 or 50 MC and 2 long question with sub questions in a time limit of 70 mins (open book).

Attendance and Participation (10%): not disclosed but I am quite active in the class but definitely not the most active ones. I attended some of the f2f classes and Jospeh could remember my name afterwards.

Group project (30%): Interim Report (5%) + Written Report (15%) + Presentation (10%)
Only interim report posted comments but without grade (excellent report with good research). In fact, I was carried by a team of intelligent groupmates and the final written report and presentation were really damn good.

Pop up quizzes and In-class exercise (17%): No pop up quizzes at all and there were just 3 or 4 in-class exercises throught the whole semester. You will be doing the exercises with your groupmates so I was being carried again.

Research Participation (3%): Just remember to register and finish before the due time when you receive email notification about marketing research and I got full score here.

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload mainly come from the group project as we were required to write a whole marketing plan but Joseph didn't teach the remaining topics (which is also required in marketing plan but not in quiz only). He had uploaded some pre-recorded videos for us but he only uploaded like 2 days before the deadline submission, so I have to watch YouTube and read textbook myself.

For quizzes, not much workload as I just watched the lecture videos back before the exam (around 6-8 videos for one quiz), so I can just spend 1 to 2 days to watch all by using 2X speed.

reviews.author: Pearl
reviews.title: i think i got good grades because i was bored??
reviews.comment_content: just pretty basic concepts of marketing. it's an intro course so that's expected too
reviews.comment_teaching:
hes fun and shares a lot of nice ads from different companies but honestly its so generic even i could take his place for this course's teaching LOL

kidding he's a wonderful potato who always asks questions in class and cherishes people's inputs
reviews.comment_grading:
participation + quizzes + group project +marketing research

quiz 3 take 2:
my best 2 are 95 and 98

group project:
top 5-9 groups i think (we asked for the score breakdown and our group is places the 44th or something out of the 220 people in all three of his classes). i had wonderful gbus and ddp groupmates who produce quality work of different natures so this was a breeze. PLEASE DONT CREATE ANOTHER APP unless its super well-done.

marketing research:
just remember to do LOL

participation:
THIS IS THE REAL DIFFERENTIATION.
answer as many questions as you can in the course. i normally just hopped on the class, answered a question and then leave LOL. Skipped a couple of classes too but he don't seem to care - what matters is ACTIVE participation (aka speak up for your GPA)

the last class was group project presentation and i was bored so i decided to question other groups business models (sorry!). raised a ton of questions and i ended up with an overall A without having done or participated much in this class at all.

His grading is very non-transparent and my groupmates got scores ranging from B- to A depending on the level of participation. dedicate your effort wisely hunties!
reviews.comment_workload:
workload where??

the exams are extremely easy and they don't matter much anyway - go focus on the group project and participation

choose your group members wisely i did and this whole course was a piece of cake

reviews.author: orangepopsicle
reviews.comment_content:
- Purpose of Marketing
- Managing Marketing Information
- Consumer Markets and Consumer Buyer Behavior
- Marketing Strategy: Segmenting, Targeting & Positioning
- Product: Branding Strategy
- Pricing Concept
- Marketing Channels
- Promotion
- Marketing Ethics and Social Responsibility
- Marketing and Social Businesses
- Marketing & Politics
- Product Development & Innovation (Not included in the quiz)

The contents are pretty straight forward.  You won't really have trouble understanding them as long as you listen to class or read the textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Puig is very passionate and likes to discuss with students.  She sometimes get sidetracked during lectures discussing with students.  I personally don't like this kind of teaching style and got kinda stressed because you have to talk every class to get full participation marks, but I guess it's okay, since the live participation takes less than 2% of the whole grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 35% -- 34/40 (Mean: 31.6)
Marketing Plan (Group Project) 35% -- 9.5/10 (Mean: 8.4)
Peer Evaluation 10% -- ?
Class Participation 20%
- Online class participation 1.67% -- 5/10 (Mean: 6.5)
- 2 Topic essays 11.67% -- 3/3 (Mean 2.6)
- In class activity 6.66% -- 2/3 (Mean 2.6)

Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
The professor highly encourages the students to read the assigned parts from the textbook.  I only read a half of them and managed to get a score a bit higher than the mean.

Team project is one of the main things in this course which requires you to form a group of five and come up with a marketing plan of something at HKUST campus.
This can be different from each group, but I personally thought it is a lot of work because you need to write a 4-page written report and do a presentation on it within a month.  My group had one or two meetings each week, each lasting around 2 hours (working individually as well).
Topic essays are fine.  You can write whatever you want about the contents covered in class.

reviews.author: CY_0935
reviews.title: Easy course for extrovert
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is not very hard as this is consider a beginner level marketing course. Hence, you might not find it very insightful especially when you are not interested in Marketing. As long as you willing to spend some time to revise the course materials, you should be able to handle this course quite well.
reviews.comment_teaching: I personally quite like Amy teaching as she not only teaching the course materials but share some extra information with us also. And she always try very hard to interact with the class and encourage idea exchanging.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is based on quizzes, group project, class participation, in-class activities and academic research.

There is 3 quizzes in total but the professor will only take the two highest one into consideration. So it is quite flexible for you. For class participation, you need to be active and response to professor's questions during classes. This is not easy especially when you are in the 9am class. In terms of in-class activities, professor will usually announce when there is a in-class activities and remind people to join, so better not miss it. Academic research is quite chill as well, you just need to do a few survey then you can easily get all the bonus point. Just to reminded that to register ASAP when there is a new survey release so you don't have to worry about it anymore later in the semester.

The mean is always super high and if you miss a few points, it is probably you will be below mean. You will want to spend more time to go through the extra assigned learning from professor to ensure a high/full mark in quizzes. However, if you are aiming for an average score, revising the slides materials from professor is sufficient.
reviews.comment_workload:
The other workload is quite chill, only for the two group projects where you really need to invest some time to do it.

In overall, the workload is consider acceptable as long as you have some responsible group members.

reviews.comment_content:
3 main focus:
3Cs - Company, Customer, Competitors (External Environment)
STP - Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning
4Ps - Product, Place, Pricing, Promotion
reviews.comment_teaching:
The presentation slides that she shows in lectures are slightly different from the one she uploads. She includes some examples in her lecture slides to aid understanding of students.
A combination of reading of presentation slides and showing videos were used by Christine during the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite Strict, minor mistakes may lead to a drop in letter grade
You get an A+ by getting 97 or above for the overall course.

Grading structure (FYI):
Best 2 quizzes (3 in total) - 27% each
Group project report - 23%
Group project presentation - 10%
In-class exercise- 10%
Research participation - 3%
Individual class participation - +/- 10% (Most students won't get an increase or decrease from this section)

Attendance is required in order to participate in the in-class exercises and gain extra credit from individual class participation.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 Quizzes - short answer format, not cumulative, focuses on each of the 3 main components (3Cs, STP, 4Ps)
The workload for 3 quizzes isn't much if you focus in class. Presentation slides are useful for revision.

Group Project - A 10-page marketing report on a product/service chosen by your group. I had great group mates so the workload wasn't heavy. Christine emphasise that each project is unique, and therefore your group can decide on the aspects to include in the project (3Cs, STP, 4Ps).

reviews.author: chelsea111
reviews.title: Great course in general
reviews.comment_content:
Course introduction
Overview of marketing
Customer, Company, Competitor
STP
4Ps
Due to the chaos in HK, we didn't finish price and promotion parts this semester.
Generally speaking, the contents are not difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Wang is one of the best teachers that I've ever met in HKUST. He can make the contents more attractive by adding in examples and keep students attentive by organizing discussions in class. Sometimes he would like to talk about stories or jokes about himself, which I personally think are quite interesting. But he may teach a little fast from time to time, so it would be better if you can read the slides before class.
And I really think Prof. Wang is charming and has a lot to be learnt from in terms of personality. You can see passion, profession and intelligence on him.
reviews.comment_grading:
Actually I was very worried at the begginning hearing about how Wenbo was a "killer". But it turned out that my grade is better than I imagined, didn't drag down by GPA so much.
We only had two quizes this semester and the better one was counted. We didn't have the presentation and its weight was added to the written report.
Here are the statistics:
quizes: mean: 21/25   19.5/25  high: 25/25   24/25
mine: 21/25, 22/25  
The scores for report and participation were enclosed.
Research credit: 3/3
Final grade: B+ (Thank you Wenbo, I thought I might get a B- or C+)
I think the key to this course is to be proactive in class and make the professor remember you. Speak up as much as possible. If you aim at A range, I think answering or raising at least one question each class is a must.
Quiz and project are also very important. Plz remember to recite every examples in slides clearly and pay attention to the examples told in class as well. They would all be tested in quizes and could be confusing.
For the project, I personally think the professor put more importance on the logic than the creativity of idea. Your customer demand and market size should be strongly supported by data from research, instead of just "blowing water". If you have time, it'd be a good idea to make an appointment with him in advance and ask him what he want from the report.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light compared with other SBM courses.
You only need to review hard before quizes and prepare well for your project. We didn't do the presentation this semster because of the cancellation of face-to-face lecture, which is great haha:)

reviews.author: YCL2018
reviews.title: Highlights of the Day
reviews.comment_content:
This course basically goes through the super foundation knowledge about marketing and for someone like me, who had no exposure to marketing previously, it is most likely to broaden your understanding of what marketing is. The course follows a marketing framework which I am sure you will find on a lot of the other reviews here so I won't dive into it.
The content is not hard to understand as long as you put adequate effort into studying it before quizzes and the textbook isn't necessary to score well in quizzes (just the lecture notes will suffice).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Wenbo is quite passionate for teaching especially  this course considering that he has taught it for the past couple of years (his other courses are MBA courses). His expertise and long time teaching of this course has allowed him to build a course that facilitates open discussions and help foster students understanding instead of the Asian way of studying - memorization.
Professor Wenbo's teaching is also quite funny and for some reasons, in the examples he gives regarding real-life marketing, he often uses comedic examples which basically keeps you awake for the whole class.
reviews.comment_grading:
I do recognize that this course may be hard for introverts considering the amount of discussions that occur in class and its impact on the students' grades. However, I think the overall grading system has been considerably fair and allowed for deserving students to thrive.
If you aren't that extroverted or generally is not that active in class, this professor may not be most suitable for you. Nonetheless, the sometimes excessive in-class participation could help you build up the confidence to speak in front of a group of people who are just there for the attendance grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low in this course. Apart from the final project report, I hardly found myself stressed out or cramming before the deadline. There is basically no homework throughout the semester, and the only workload comes from the 1 hour study-time before each quiz (total of three) and the short case studies that we are required to read*.
The final project could get a little hectic since its also due during the finals season and could get chaotic if you have bad group mates. With that said, as you can pick your own group, just make sure you pick one with minimal free-riders to get the work done.
*Considering how popular many of these case studies are, you can definitely Google them and find the key points that will aid your class discussions.

reviews.author: therock
reviews.title: Fun and Relatively Easy A
reviews.comment_content: I found the content super interesting, we cover the basics of marketing so: 3Cs (Company, Customer, Competition), STP (Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning), and 4Ps (Promotion, Price, Place, Product). Loads of cool case studies, and content is relatively easy to understand and follow, even with the speed we go through them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Christine was the best prof I've had since coming to UST. Mainly because, unlike all my other professors, she actually gives feedback (revolutionary, I know). She also engages the class quite well, and it's clear she's super knowledgeable.
reviews.comment_grading: Christine's grading is really good! I got 1.26 above mean on first quiz, 0.8 above mean on second quiz, and got A+. She didn't release the group project grades on canvas, so not sure what my team got, but we got good feedback after our presentation so I'm guessing that's what helped me get such a good grade. What I think helps a lot is she gives +/- 10% for participation (i.e. it's not part of the official grade breakdown, but if you participated a lot, you can go up 10%).
reviews.comment_workload: Not bad at all, considering my final grade I didn't work THAT much. I studied for the first two quizzes about a week in advance for 1-2 hours a day, didn't study for the third quiz at all bc was too busy with another class. But it's ok because she takes best 2 out of 3 for grading. For final project maybe spent 5-10 hours, I was super lucky that I had a good group (YOU CAN CHOOSE YOUR GROUP!) so we divided work effectively.

reviews.author: abpuma
reviews.title: Amazing professor!
reviews.comment_content:
1. The Marketing Concept
2. Marketing Strategy
3. Marketing Information
4. Analysis of the Marketing Environment
5. Consumer and Buyer Behaviour
6. Market Segmentation, Targeting and Positioning
7. 4Ps: Product
8. 4Ps: Price
9. 4Ps: Place
10. 4Ps: Promotion

The quizzes are very application-based and not difficult if you pay attention in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is an excellent teacher! He makes classes a lot of fun and frequently cracks jokes. He loves people who participate in class and I think that is part of the reason he gave me such a good grade. International students will find it easier to speak up.

His English is very good and his slides are very easy to follow. He's very approachable for questions and help. We had a free-rider in our group and he was very understanding of the situation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes: 50% (each 25%, best 2 quizzes out of 3)
Group Project: 25%
   Customer Analysis & Observational Research: 5%
   Written Marketing Plan: 10%
   Oral Presentation: 10%
Pop Quizzes: 12%
Attendance: 10%
Research Participation: 3%

For group project grades, he holds an iPeer event for both submissions for people to anonymously peer-review their groupmates.

The pop quizzes are basically small quizzes given at the end of most classes which based on the same lecture's content. Sometimes group, sometimes individual. Sometimes he'll let you take the quiz home and submit it in the next class.

For attendance, he passes a sheet every class for students to sign. I have also noticed him secretly noting down names of students who have spoken/participated in class.

My scores:
Quiz 1: 90/100 (Mean = 80)
Quiz 2: 77.5/100 (Mean = 80.7)
Quiz 3: 94/100 (Mean = 76)   (Quiz 1 and 3 counted for best 2)
Pop Quizzess: 56/60
Attendance: Full
Research: 3/3
Group Project:
   Observation Report: 8/10 (Mean = 7.5)
   Written Plan: 10/10 (Mean = 7.8)
   Presentation: 4.6/5 (Mean = 3.7)

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is below average, you'll need 3-4 days to study for the quizzes. The group project submissions (Observational Report and Marketing Plan) will take more effort and time so, make sure you plan your time well.

His guidelines for the marketing plan are make the scope very vast but, make sure you read and execute everything in the guidelines. (That's how our group got the only 10/10 in the class)

Sometimes he shows some videos during the class and one or two questions related to those videos will appear during the test.

reviews.author: hysze
reviews.comment_content: The objective in this course is to help students develop a broad and practical understanding of the central role that marketing plays in modern business and society.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very lecture-based. I would say if you want to have an interactive and fun class, this is definitely not it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 20%
Quiz 2 20%
Project Written Report 20%
Project Presentation 10%
Observational Research Exercise 10%
In-Class Group Exercises 12%
Class Participation +/-5%
Research Participation 3%
Student initiated Class  3% (Extra points)
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy as there was quiz, written report, project and so on. But it is still manageable!
Make sure you pick the right teammates as it still contributes a large portion to your grade.

reviews.author: charlottebless
reviews.title: Study Wenbo to learn more
reviews.comment_content:
The course taught by Wenbo is very comprehensive.
Aside from basic framework of marketing, he teaches updated marketing techniques that aren't published in textbooks. For example, how search engines, Youtube search engines generate advertisement revenue. Or even tech savvy gadgets that are able to generate insightful thoughts to the marketing brain of corporations.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wenbo is a wonderful teacher. He is strict and high expectation of students, e.g. no laptop and active participation in classes, but at the same time you learn a lot more about marketing and different cases.
reviews.comment_grading: Honestly, the reputation of him as a killer isn't really fair. In the first lesson, he actually showed that all marketing professors give almost the same % of As, Bs and Cs. As long as you pay attention to class and take a full day to study for quiz (normally I study the quiz on the day at 12pm and 1 hr for each chapter, that should be more than enough to do well in the quizzes). So choose professors according to what you can LEARN, and Wenbo is definitely one that you can learn a lot from.
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable in general. Light workload during the semester with 3 quizzes, some reading materials and attendance in class. HOWEVER, towards the end, for the final presentation, it really requires good time management and takes up time. So better have an idea confirmed beforehand so the workload won't be as heavy.

reviews.author: yannnn
reviews.comment_content: I find the course quite interesting and useful. The content is not purely theoretical but with a lot of examples and case studies. There are a lot of topics related to our daily lives, for example, RFID used to track customers' behavior in the shop and the insight generated may lead to further business decisions.
reviews.comment_teaching: At first, I find the class a bit boring perhaps due to the professor's voice but I actually like the class a lot after the semester. As he quotes a lot of real life examples, I truly learnt a lot from him. He is also very helpful if you approach him personally for advice. A very approachable professor.
reviews.comment_grading: I heard that there are professors with better gradings so I was quite worried but I did not do that well in the quiz and still manage to score well. But I put a lot of effort in the project and class participation so that might be the important part for this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
As mentioned before, you need to complete a group project in this course. Like many other courses with group projects, the workload probably depends heavily on your group mates... In general, it is not such a demanding project but for his class, I would advise you to start preparation earlier (compared to other class, the project schedule of his class started near the end of the semester and it was a busy time for all of us).

He gives you reading material but do not force you to study it. You have group discussions on these materials and he will ask you in the quiz the questions your group was assigned on to check that you are not a free-rider. But no in-depth questions.

reviews.author: hungrypotato
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers the marketing framework and marketing research, which includes:

3C: Customer, Company, Competition
STP: Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning
4P: Product, Price, Promotion, Place
Marketing Research: Exploratory and Descriptive Research

Wenbo's content is SO GOOD. Honestly lol like if you look at other lecturer's content, they teach you things that are so obvious and their content is boring. But Wenbo gets us business cases and studies from Harvard or other schools to discuss.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wenbo is the best professor I have met in HKUST. He is extremely funny and his content is GOD. Although he is quite monotone, you usually don't fall asleep in class since he's so funny and his content is so interesting.

Wenbo loves interaction during class. He likes to ask questions and expects free flow and interesting answers from students. He has a lot of interesting views towards marketing and business decisions.

However, he does not include everything in his powerpoint, so make sure you copy what he says regarding business decisions in cases, as they may be covered during the quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Quizzes x 3 (25% each, best 2 out of 3), individual work
2. Final Project Report (27%), group work
3. Final Project Presentation (10%), group work
4. Group Exercise (10%)
5. Research Credit (3%), individual work
6. Individual Class Participation (10%), individual work

The quiz covers class powerpoints, and sometimes questions on group exercises and group work to make sure no one is free riding.

The group project is on a service or product that exists/not does exist. You need to talk about the 3Cs, 4Ps and STP, and also the marketing framework, expected implementation timeline, finances etc. So imagine you are a start-up doing pitches and that's what your project will need to include.

Research credit stuff will be sent through email.

Group exercises are on business cases from Harvard and other schools. A class will be dedicated to discussing the case (2-3 in total throughout the year) and answering assigned group questions.

Individual class participation is not part of the 100% of the course grade. But you will get an extra + or - 10% (max) depending on how much you are of a positive/negative influence in class. So answer more questions and impress Wenbo with good answers, and don't doze off or chat in class as you could get marks deducted any time.

I got almost full marks for all three of my quizzes and our group did okay during presentation and the report. I also did not speak up much during class. Finally got an A-range, even though I was expecting a B-range for not being active in class! I think the group presentation is extremely important, so get good groupmates.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is manageable before the project period.

Group cases aren't too tough as one question is assigned to one group. There are quizzes once in a while but it's okay as if you pay attention in class, quiz should be okay.

Group project is tougher as Wenbo briefs the guidelines rather late (but I heard it's the same for every other class). And you have to start things from scratch. But there is sufficient time as long as you make group decisions quick (i.e. what service/product you are going to do), and don't make last minute changes.

reviews.comment_content:
know the overview of marketing (3Cs,STP,4Ps)
real life examples act as supplements to theories (can be included in quizzes)
there are materials (video clips. discussions) that are not included in PPT slides, however, will be asked in quizzes, thus attending classes is important.

willing to give feedback when you ask him
generally a nice guy
discussion are quite useful as it allows you to try to apply your knowledge which is useful when dealing with the project
reviews.comment_grading:
pretty fair
see attachment for mark distribution
(attendance are not taken every lesson but upon discussion)
reviews.comment_workload:
Quiz x 3 (each:25%, total:50%)
Project (Written Report:20%;Presentation:5%)
- need to use much time to come up with a topic yourself and apply all marketing
Observational Research Exercise:8%
In-Class Group Exercises (<-attendance) :9%

Research Participation: 3%

reviews.author: sana
reviews.comment_content:
some basic marketing concepts
a whole frame look of Marketing
reviews.comment_teaching:

The ppt is well organized and clear enough for u to review
during the class, there r also videos, pictures aiding u to understand
reviews.comment_grading: do well in the group project and get 2 above mean quizzes >>> a grade

Doing the group project during final week is tough...

reviews.author: Heidili1706
reviews.comment_content: He taught general stuff about marketing such as 3Cs, STP. All of his materials are beyond the textbooks can only rely on his ppt.
reviews.comment_teaching: He taught well in class with huge of examples. You can raise any question and discuss with him anytime during the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Average grade is C. But if you have good group mates to carry you throughout the project would be fine.
There are three quizzes which only count the highest two.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload, a project with three quizzes. and no final exam.

reviews.author: toxicustjj
reviews.title: Don't reg this course if you have other choices
reviews.comment_content: The content is fair as marketing is an easy subject and nothing is difficult or challenging. Some powerpoints in lectures will not be uploaded to Canvas and you better attend all the lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She worked in the US for several years, so she knows the workplace and market quite well. Although she is well-knowledged, she never told students what she wants and what is good work. It is hard to attain her standard(Especially in the group project, she never thinks the ideas is good enough)

And any electronic devices is restricted to use during lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Bad.
Even you did well in quizzes (all above mean 1sd), if your project is not good enough, your grade will be turned down quite hard. I've got slightly below mean in projects, and finally I only got a C+.
If you can swap into other marketing courses, just go asap.
reviews.comment_workload:
Having 3 quizzes, only count the best 2.
(50% of grade)
A small project
(3 people in a group)
Group project
(6-7 people in a group)(VERY IMPORTANT!!!)
Attendance
(TA will mark your name, PRS is not used)

Compare to other marketing courses, Christine's course has more projects and a higher standard. Quizzes are more difficult.

reviews.author: Francium
reviews.title: Bad grading, Good professor
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces some simple marketing concepts like 4P(Product, Price, Promotion, Place), 3C (Customers, Company, Competitors) and STP (Segmentation, Targeting and Positioning).
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would say his teaching is brilliant.  He provided students with new insights into marketing. He could analyze marketing puzzles/phenomenon quantitatively and he had exceptional critical thinking skills. Unlike boring stuffs in textbook, he taught students how companies were adopting technologies like eye-tracking in marketing and he played numerous videos to engage students.

He was funny and I enjoyed having his lessons very much.
reviews.comment_grading:
BAD grading system. You will get a C or C+ if you get mean score in projects and quizzes.

There were 3 quizzes in total, 25% each and only the best two (in terms of your ranking in class) would be counted.

+/-10% individual participation, 3% research credit

Group projects and participation comprised the rest 47% of the course, but no score was released and the grading system was not transparent.

My performance:
Quiz 1: full mark (mean 83.6  sd 11)
Quiz 2: 88/100 (mean 71.1 )
Quiz 3: I did not attend (mean 75.1)

Note: The quizzes were relatively hard as there could be more than 1 correct option in the multiple-choice questions

I eventually got B+ after scoring >1sd above mean in quiz 2 and full mark in quiz 1
reviews.comment_workload:
3 quizzes(25 mc questions), 1 individual case study, 2-3 group case studies(pretty long and hard), a 8-minute presentation and submit a 10-page final report.

Please make sure that you can find trustworthy and responsible  group members. There were two free riders in my group and the workload became very heavy. I had to work overnight for several days at the end of the semester.

reviews.author: ip
reviews.comment_content:
Typical marketing frameworks
4Ps , 5Cs , STP, advertising and packaging etc
reviews.comment_teaching: He is patient and he tries to ask questions. He is also willing to answer your questions after lessons and through emails. He replies email quite frequently. He is nice and friendly.
reviews.comment_grading:
As the quizzes are straightforward the sd is very small, it mostly depends on your projectmates. However, as the grouping is determined by Professor Kim, you cannot choose your own groupmates.

If you mess up with your project, C range is guaranteed.
reviews.comment_workload:
low workload assuming that you have good projectmates.
-best 2 quizzes out of 3
-marketing puzzle (2 pages)
-marketing report (12 pages)

*Caution: being able to choose good and decent with good logic groupmates is super important as you have to write a 12 page marketing report for a new product/ an existing product entering a new market.  Choosing a good grade professor can be risky.

reviews.author: hyyyy
reviews.title: christine is real good!
reviews.comment_content:
introductory course to marketing
STP, 4Ps, 3Cs, marketing channels etc
reviews.comment_teaching:
christine is an excellent teacher, vivid and clear presentation of ideas
she likes attentive and proactive students, doesn't allow eating. drinking, and using laptops and cellphone
attendance is taken at the beginning of every class; she mentioned she did not like students being late;
reviews.comment_grading:
KW: 7/10(Mean: 8.8 High: 10 Low: 7)
Quiz: 19, 19 , 18    / 25
only count the two best quizzes, so u can skip one
reviews.comment_workload:
3 quizzes, keyword report+presentation, final report+ presentation, NO FINAL EXAM; in class worksheets
pretty much depends on your groupmates and the time u devote to this subject

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.title: If it wasn't a business core course I wouldn't consider taking it...
reviews.comment_content:
3C
Marketing research
STP

All Â§ßË∑ØÂò¢...
reviews.comment_teaching: He does not only teach by following the ppt but also give a lot of daily life examples. We had a lot of videos to watch as well ^_^ and some are really funny. He also tells erotic jokes -_- and many of us laughed... But on some occasions it's really boring that I nearly fell asleep...
reviews.comment_grading:
25%x2 Quizzes (3 in total, only best 2 count towards final grade)
27% Final project report
10% Final project presentation (at most 2 ppl per group)
10% Group exercise (Case study)
3% Research credit (attend 3 sessions of research participation)
