For me I got slightly below mean in the best two quizzes, and I only participated very little in class. I thought our group project did well as well. In the end I got a C...... so swap out of Wenbo's class if you are pre-regged into it.
reviews.comment_workload:
You have to prepare for two case discussions (Starbucks and IKEA), one counts individual participation and the other counts group work. The three quizzes do require some revision. For group project, it's okay if you don't need to present but the workload will be much more if you are the one presenting. The final report also need some efforts to make it good.
The only thing relieving is that there is no final exam...

reviews.author: ywhang
reviews.comment_content:
Standard related to Marketing. Easy Stuff and common sense.
Remember to read the textbook, most of the contents of the quizzes come from textbook. Buying a book may be optional, depending how much changes in the editions as there are always lots of changes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Bad English, hardly understand a single word. Also, she couldnot give precise instruction on the requirement, it is confusing. She loves non-local students more, you could observe it on the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: All quizzes above mean with 1 max. B+ only. Very bad grade in business course
reviews.comment_workload: 3 quizzes, presentation, case study. not too much.

reviews.author: Shermin
reviews.title: Great Professor!
reviews.comment_content: Good fundamental knowledge about Marketing. Got me interested in learning more about Marketing.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great teacher, learns everyone's name which makes the class more personalized, uses memorable and visual examples in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading it pretty decent. Professor is always ready to give feedback so it is easy to improve assignment and group project throughout the semster.
reviews.comment_workload: The group project can seem a intensive as it spaces out over 3 months. The exams are mostly based on the lectures so if you attend the lectures, you should be good to go!

reviews.author: ani
reviews.comment_content: Really straightforward and good course. Teaches about marketing, consumer behaviour, pricing strategies and much more. The mid term is multiple choice and has negative marking.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good and funny. He is a very good teacher and tries to engage with his students. A lot of videos are shown through the course to engage with students. Also uses a ton a business case studies that you have to read before coming to class as then you will not know what he is talking about.
reviews.comment_grading: Ok grading. There are midterms and a final exam that you have to do.You will be tested on the reading material business case studies as often times they will pop up on the exams.
reviews.comment_workload: not that heavy, have two team projects, choose team wisely because there will be a  lot of team work and meetings. Also for the final project you will have to meet the professor for approval of team proposal so everyone should be present. There is also peer evaluation at the end and peer scoring for the final project and mis term project .r

reviews.author: PPBBB
reviews.title: Not as good grade as others said
reviews.comment_content:
This is a compulsory course in studying BBA in HKUST.
Contents were basically 3Cs (company, competitors, customers), STP (Segmentation, targeting and positioning) as well as 4Ps (Price, place, promotion, products).
The contents are useful for your future career for sure!
reviews.comment_teaching: Fabulous teaching style and she gave a lot of examples to illustrate her ideas. Sometimes made jokes in class. She was responsive to students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not that good as other reviews said.
The class means is high on quizzes.
Quizzes usually consist of 25-26 questions in which 5 questions is designed based on the content of the assigned textbook. Other 20-21 questions covered stuff taught in class. So I think a textbook is not compulsory and I borrowed from a library at that time.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was not that heavy.
No final exam, no midterm exam but 3 quizzes. There were some random assignments during lessons so you have to bear the cost of not attending the lessons. A group of six had to complete a project, a marketing proposal, which actually covered all stuff you had learned throughout the course.

reviews.author: Emily Li
reviews.title: Best Prof ever
reviews.comment_content:
Easy to follow and pick up
Mostly about 4Ps(place. product  etc)
STP (strategy, targeting, and promotion)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fascinating and intriguing.
Used a lot of examples and video to support, an adequate amount of humorous.
Can easily catch attention and arouse your interest in marketing!
reviews.comment_grading:
Mostly look on your participation in class
two midterms above 1sd,
high participation
satisfactory performance in group project/
got an A
reviews.comment_workload:
normal. Only require effort in class and making cheatsheet. Might need some time to read books, but workload is not really high
In addition, a group project is required. You will be asked to create a business unit and help them to promote.
Might need to attend 2-3 marketing experiments, but its only 20 min

reviews.author: Jhalak
reviews.comment_content: This is an introductory marketing course, mainly deals with the 3C's, STP, 4P's and Societal & Sustainable Marketing. The end goal of the course is to formulate a marketing plan which covers all the above topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Coral's teaching is very different- more interactive, engaging and fun. She links her lessons with stories and videos for us to understand better. She is very approachable and shares a lot of hands-on knowledge about Marketing.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was fair and pretty direct, class participation really mattered. The quizzes were easy.
reviews.comment_workload: Less workload, 3 quizzes, 1 case analysis, 1 group project (presentation + report) and plenty of time given in class to discuss and work.

reviews.author: klaw
reviews.title: Best professor for learning practical marketing
reviews.comment_content:
Tbh until now I'm still quite confused.

Always changes the syllabus until after the second quiz. And what she tested on the quiz is different than the required reading stated in the syllabus.

However, she did teach us a lot of practical marketing instead of terms and definitions stated in the textbook like other professors. She arranged a talk with Revlon's CEO and have a guest lecturer came and taught us about Promotion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
When she teaches more about the content, the class is super boring. However, she would always digress every now and then and tell stories from her company and experiences and that's where the class gets interesting. There is also an Innovation Class that is basically a short version of the usual Innovation Workshop she gives to companies.

She likes student who participate, but make sure you started participating early! (The first or second class).
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite abstract (?)

As long as you got on her good side I think you'll be fine. A range is a guarantee. Even though quiz is a 50%, it doesn't really matter if you score high or not. Maybe try to not get below mean is already enough.

All 3 quizzes are taken into account as opposed to other professors.
reviews.comment_workload:
Studying for the quiz are not very hard, sparing several hours before the actual quiz is enough.
She basically guides you through the merketing case analysis about Beyonce, so no added workload.
She also encouraged us to start the marketing plan early and helped us throughout. She almost always spares the last 20 minutes of class every week to check our progress with the plan and for consultation. Just make sure you do what she told you to do and you will be her favorite group.

reviews.author: swaggerjaggerry
reviews.title: Coral = your second best friend
reviews.comment_content:
Course Intro + Purpose of Marketing
Managing Marketing info
Consumer markets and Consumer buyer behavior
Marketing strategy: STP
Product - branding strategy
Pricing - understanding and capturing customer value
Place - marketing channels
Promotion

WHAT DO WE DO IN MARKETING?????
WE RELIEF CONSUMER TENSIONS!!!!!!
^^^^you gotta know this unless u wanna die
(tested in quiz 1 and quiz 2)

good introductory marketing course, gives u everything u need to know about the basics of marketing
reviews.comment_teaching:
Coral is a very active, engaging, lively, and aged women from Barcelona with an accent
She likes people who participate in class and voices out opinions (I MEAN IT !!!!!!!)

She's not the usual marketing lecturer who will teach you textbook contents (she hates that) and will teach you more practical marketing things, and likes to share stories in class, which is kinda fun
...which means u gotta study on your own for the quizzes
BUT u gotta still come to class for participation (VERY FRIGGIN IMPORTANT!!!) and ur dead if she doesnt know ur name by heart
Very western teaching, not your usual prof, you need to get in her good side
She gives a lot of time for group discussions during class hours to consult with her
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean:
Quiz 1 - 18.2/22
Quiz 2 - 15.8/21
Quiz 3 - 14.9/20
Quiz 3 (bonus questions*) - 1.9/3
*YOU HAVE TO COME TO HER INNOVATION CLASS/WORKSHOP TO ACE THESE 3 BONUS POINTS!!!!!! I REPEAT, YOU HAVE TO !!!!!!!
(No stats for mark plan & case analysis)

If you want to secure an A range you have to be an active class participant, do okay in the quizzes, be in a good group with good teammates, AND GET CORAL TO KNOW U AND LIKE U
No attendance but YOU MUST COME TO CLASS just do it
reviews.comment_workload:
Quizzes 50% Individual
Case Analysis 17% Team
Marketing Plan 20% Team
In-class activities 10% Team/Individual
Marketing Experiment 3% Individual

- Individual scores can be adjusted based on peer evaluations
- Participation in discussions & etiquette (eg, be punctual, no talking, no phones). Please, use a paper with your full English name in front of you during class.
- Activities related to lectures/videos. Attend your assigned section to receive credit!

Presentation at the end (everyone must present)
No finals tho

reviews.author: T123
reviews.title: MARK2120 great course
reviews.comment_content:
The course is very well-structured and divided into three parts:
Part 1: Three C's
- Company
- Customer
- Competitor
Part 2: STP
- Segmentation
- Targeting
- Positioning
- Branding
Part 3: Four P's
- Product
- Price
- Place
- Promotion
The group project is about creating a marketing plan, that includes everything you learn in class, about a new product
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Kim is a great professor, she speaks very clearly and fluently. In every class she does not allow the use of phones or laptops to make sure each student focuses and does not distract others. She tries very hard to make every class engaging, by asking questions about content or our opinions. She welcomes students stories that relate to the content being discussed. She uses powerpoints, stories and videos to illustrate her points, making classes fun to attend.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Three in-class quizzes (only the best two are counted)
- Observational Research Exercise (done in pairs, 2 pages)
- Group Project (presentation + report, done in groups of 5)
- Attendance (+/- 5% meaning if you do not attend then 5% will be removed)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is a bit heavy, as the group project is quite intensive and is worth a lot of the final grade. It can be a bit challenging to come up with an initial idea, but keep in contact with the professor, she is very willing to discuss ideas.
For the quizzes, just read over the powerpoints, there's a few parts from the textbook but not essential to read every page.

reviews.author: whoever
reviews.title: Good grade
reviews.comment_content: Contents are mainly about consumer behaviors, namely STP(segmentation, targeting, positioning), 4Ps(product, price, promotion, place) and 3Cs(customers, company, competitors).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Christine forbid students using laptop and smartphones in her lessons.
She used a lot of real-life examples and videos in lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good, 20% of students got A range.
Best 2 quizzes out of 3---25% each
Group project report---25%
Group project present---10%
Observational research exercise---10%
In-class exercise---2%
Research participation---3%
Class participation--- +-5%
reviews.comment_workload:
Similar to other instructors' marketing course, 1.observational research exercise
2.group project
3.3 mid-term
4.some easy in-class exercise

reviews.author: ma ho yi
reviews.comment_content: The course teaches some basic consumer behavior concepts which is related to psychology. It is quite interesting. There are also concepts about marketing strategies and a group project which requires the group to design a whole marketing plan.
reviews.comment_teaching: Christine uses so many real life examples and practical implications which makes the concepts easier to understand. She forbids us to use mobile devices in class but i think it really make the class attentive
reviews.comment_grading: Good and fair grading. 20 percentage get A range. She checks each and every assignments seriously and give opinions.
reviews.comment_workload: Not very heavy. Only observation research and project. Adequate time to.complete the project

reviews.author: nsy
reviews.comment_content:
Materials are quite good
3 quizzes throughout the semester (2 best will be count), some in-class group assignment
reviews.comment_teaching:
lectures are interactive, quite a lot of examples and videos are given
the professor is quite friendly and she is willing to answer our questions
cant use computer during lessons
reviews.comment_grading:
Best 2 Quizzes (out of 3)  25%
Group Project Report  25%
Group Project Presentation 10%
Observational Research Exercise 10%
In-Class Group Exercises 2%
Research Participation 3%
Individual Class Participation +/- 5%
reviews.comment_workload:
Observation Research Exercise: (~2 pages writing)
-  2 people group work
-  go out to any business to observe some customer behavior

Project:
- presentation and written report is needed

reviews.author: Abishek
reviews.title: Interesting Course even for non-business students
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fairly straightforward, the professor broke it down nicely into bite-sized chunks and the connections between different areas is extremely clear.

The main plus point is that the focus is not on simply remembering definitions but on understanding how the "building of marketing" is built and I think that makes this course a lot more interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is extremely interesting, makes the subject really come alive! Its clear that she has a real passion for the subject and makes it come alive for the students
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is really straightforward, if you attend and talk properly in class you can secure 20+% just like that.

In terms of the group work it is challenging but the professor gave a lot of good guidance and ran in-class brainstorming sessions so you can pick from a range of ideas and use them to improve on your own.

The final quiz is a little more challenging than just remembering the definitions but as long as you attend class you should be fine!

I was able to get an A+ for this course but I was really into it so have to take that into consideration.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not trivial, it also varies with the group that you have and honestly how commited you are to building your case study and marketing plan.

You have 1 case study (ours was on Beyonce) and 1 marketing plan on any product you create. I got lucky with my group but there were groups that had issues so be careful during group selection.

reviews.title: Favorite Professor
reviews.comment_content:
3Cs, 4Ps, STP, etc.
Marketing 101 for you
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is absolutely one of my favorite professors so far. Some people seem to have a negative impression of her because she grades harshly (which isn't false) but she is the nicest Canadian lady who has a great sense of humor (lots of people in the class didn't seem to understand her humor tho. pity) and is greatly enthusiastic when she teaches.
One of the greatest thing was her English fluency. Another thing is how flexible she is and how willing she is to listen to your questions and genuinely try to help you out.
reviews.comment_grading:
You take 3 quizzes and they take the score for the top 2. I did quite well (only got 2-3 wrong out of 25)
The assignment grading can get quite harsh, especially because the mean is relatively high for all of them. Make sure you go to her class because she'll give you an attendance check out of nowhere on the basis of classwork. So if I missed a class I'll go make up for it at a different session. Just sit in and do it yourself. Nothing too difficult.
My overall grade was still slightly lower than expected (we did especially well for our final project. But to be fair the presentation was only 10% of the total grade). Just try your best to impress her and make sure she remembers you.
reviews.comment_workload:
Fairly heavy, especially when it gets to the case. Some of my group members didn't live on campus so it was fairly difficult to work on them. Just pray that you don't have a free rider.

Though there arne't midterms or finals, since the 3 quizzes are spread out throughout the semester, it kinda just feels endless tbh.

reviews.author: a.stupid
reviews.title: Quizzes are ambiguous
reviews.comment_content: Basic stuff about marketing - the course content is well structured. It start's from Company, Competitors and Customers (3C) to Strategy, Targeting and Positioning (STP), and the classical 4P. An elegant and handy model to understand the basics of marketing strategies.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kim's teaching is good. She speaks fluent English and can explain the concepts very clear with the aid of real world examples. She is also willing to answer the additional questions of students. When my group has finished present she pointed out the key concept that we missed and suggested some ways to improve the report. After that we have get an A+ in the report, and heard from her that only 2 groups have got this grading.
reviews.comment_grading:
GRADING IS SHIT. DO NOT REG HER COURSE IF YOU WANT GOOD GRADE

project 35%
observational research 10%
2 Quizzes 50%
Lab 5%

I scored an A+ in both project and observational research, scored slightly below mean in 2 quizzes, get a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is so-so. I am lucky to have a really good project mate that helped a lot on the report. So the workload is not that large.

reviews.author: Âç°ÊñØ
reviews.title: Inspirational teaching but poor grade
reviews.comment_content: A typical business core.But her content is fully copied from the textbook and some insight invloved.It's good if you really want to remember some fundamental concepts rather than only learning some cases which may not be systematic.
reviews.comment_teaching: Overall,she speaks a fluent english as she comes from Harvard.One point to note is she merely read the powerpoint and the rationale behind is your duty to comprehend.
reviews.comment_grading:
Extremely poor
As the mean of her course is around C which is different from all other business core.
I asked for the reason of her grading, she basically said each element is assessed by relative grading,which means if two group got an A in group project, your group must not get an A.It's quite unreasonable as there are quota.
Probably,other professors graded by the overall performace based on the relative grading but not each element has a seperated relative grading.It's unfair for those who get a extremely high mark in one element but average mark in other elements.
DON'T REGISTER HER COURSE IF YOU WANT A GOOD GRADE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: Same as other professor.The quizzes is held sporadically so may be heavier than other core subjects.

reviews.author: Rexkwok
reviews.title: Good grading but try not to sleep in the lecture
reviews.comment_content:
There are three quizzes in total, and only the best two results will be counted in your final grade. 30 multiple choices. Not cumulative. The duration only lasts 1 hour for each quiz and most likely you'll finish it without half an hour. They're not difficult if you remember the examples Kim taught in classes. Most of them are mentioned before.

A project is involved. Your group mates are assigned by Kim. Just think of a brand-new project and present it.

There're group exercises in each lecture. Be present, just write down your name and have some discussions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of my friends said Kim is bored. I think it depends. Be reminded that he'll remember your name and ask you questions suddenly. Just be awake.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is good. Just revise before the day of quiz. I only attended two quizzes, and for both I just got them higher the SD. (but without even 1 SD) Like the total score is 30, I got 25 while the mean is 23 and SD is 3.5. My final grade is A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is relatively light. As I remember, only an assignment has to be done by group and also, of course, the final project. That's all of it.

What's matter is that you're assigned to have good and responsible group mates.

reviews.author: Patrick970808
reviews.comment_content: Content include: What is Marketing, Company, Understanding the Environment, MR, Consumer, Segmentation and Targeting, Differentiation and Positioning, Ethics, Products, Price, Distribution and Advertising.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is quite boring at times but I think he is quite nice. He doesn't mind you approaching him other than class time and says hi when he sees you around in campus.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good in my opinion. I am higher than the mean around 1 SD but my final grade is an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. Two best quizzes out of three and they are easy. There are group project and in-class participation. No mid-term and final exam.

reviews.author: walkman186
reviews.comment_content: Lectures are based on powerpoint slides produced by the textbook publisher. Content is fairly easy and straightforward.
reviews.comment_teaching: The pace is decent, I had one 3 hour class every week, so we covered 2 topics in one class. Participation marks are given when you answer one of his questions, therefore just remember to answer his questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Very easy to get a good grade if you are willing to memorise all the examples he raises in class and the notes on the lecture slides.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light, 2 all MC Quizzes (20% each), Case Analysis (12%), Marketing Plan (20%), and others are class participation and experiments.

reviews.author: Wenus
reviews.title: An interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
This course mainly introduces some basic concepts of marketing from 3C, STP and 4P. The concepts are not that difficult and they are quite interesting. Some topics are taught in BAFS in secondary school.
There are some readings and videos included in this courses and they will be examined in the quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Kim is very nice and he is willing to offer many supports in the group research assignment and the group project. His teaching is quite interesting but his voice is too soft.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are total 3 quizzes in this course but only 2 of them are included for the final grade and the total contribution of quizzes to the final grade is 50%.
Quiz 1 25%
Quiz 2 25%
Quiz 3 25%
o Project Written Report 20%
o Project Presentation 5%
o Observational Research Exercise 8%
o In-Class Group Exercises 9%
o Class Participation +/- 5%
o Research Participation 3%
The overall grade is ok for me.
reviews.comment_workload: There are just 1 group assignment and 1 group project in this course, and only few content is examined in the quizzes. What you need to revise are only the lecture notes, readings and the videos included in the powerpoint.

reviews.author: allankarson
reviews.comment_content:
It is about understanding the market & customers and how to create value for them.
1. Understanding the environment (which are customer, company, and competition) -> 3Cs
2. Setting the strategy ( segmentation, targeting, and positioning) -> STP
3. Marketing Mix (product, price, promotion, and place) -> 4Ps
reviews.comment_teaching:
In my opinion, he is funny and teaches really well. Anirban is friendly and recognizes each of his students' name (not joking, ofc after a few classes). What is good about his teaching is he uses the examples that the students are familiar of. He likes to give students the big picture of the course, so that you can link each lecture session with the previous lecture sessions. Highly recommend you guys to take his class.

I enjoy how he encourage students to give out their ideas and analyze the examples/ topic he teaches,
reviews.comment_grading:
1. There are 3 quizzes in total (2 of them are during the term, and another one is Final exam). The mean of the quizzes are pretty high. To ace the quiz, you definitely need to attend the lectures as Professor Anirban like to test something he said in class. Also, make sure you jotted down the examples he gave.

2. Project Report is a Marketing Plan that you make for a company, by analyzing the 3Cs, setting the STP, and formulating the 4Ps. When I took his class, it was about setting up marketing plan of a new restaurant for a particular restaurant group. This is done per group (5-6 people).

3. Presentation is about presenting your final report/marketing plan.

4. ORE is a observation exercise that is done usually by 2 people. Students are asked to observe consumers' behavior and activities, then just report what you observed and what insights you can provide. You can choose any consuming activity, up to you.  

Lastly, participating in the class will certainly be beneficial for you and gain you participation marks, you can ask questions or give out your ideas. He recognizes all of his students. And since people get high scores or score the same on quizzes, participation mark could give students another chance to increase their grades.

Best 2 Quizzes : Total 50%
Final Project Report: 25%
Project Presentation: 10%
Observational Research Exercise: 10%
In-Class Group Exercises: 2%
Research Participation: 3%
Class Participation: +/- 5%
reviews.comment_workload: It depends on how much effort you put to the course. Quite a lot of things to do, but i think as long as you enjoy the course, you will be fine doing the assignments.

reviews.author: Wes
reviews.title: Easy-going
reviews.comment_content: There are quite a lot of content. You have to attend the lectures so as to understand those ideas in the slides since he will be giving example on it. The most most important point is that some in-class exercises will appear in quiz and finals.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is quite a nice guy, and always raise questions. Sometimes he may pick someone to answer if there are no one answering him.
reviews.comment_grading:
I am not so sure if the performance of the group project ruined my final grading, but the quiz are all quite easy if you listen to him during class. Attendance is taken randomly through in-class exercise, so you better check the slides before classes to see if there is any in-class exercise (if you want to skip the lesson)
And class participation is not graded. it will only be graded by taking attendance in the final project presentation days, so it will be ok to remain silence during class.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework at all. There are only one small project (three in a group, 2 pages), one final project (5-6 in a group, 15-20 min) and some in-class exercises. Perhaps if you want a good grade you have to read the suggested readings since there would be one or two questions regarding them in the quiz.
there will be 3 quiz, and only the best 2 will be graded.

reviews.author: Anmol
reviews.comment_content: The content is relatively simple and easy to understand. The course is mainly based on group projects, with a few quizzes to test your knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is relatively good. Although, you have to look over the lecture notes and textbook before quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair and is based on the amount of work your group puts it. However, your group should be willing to work as well as the projects are usually given one collective group mark and not individual marks.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light during the semester. However, it gets heavy towards the end since all the projects are due then. So it is better to be prepared in advance rather than rushing the projects as it can greatly affect your marks.

reviews.author: Mimi
reviews.comment_content: Content a bit outdated, but easy to understand. Mainly slides and book. If you really want to get a good grade, go through the book and look for specific terms, she would ask those.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not much interaction/ discussion in class. Reviews on group projects or assignment are available only at the end of the sem. She would somtimes be absent and not tell us
reviews.comment_grading: Mean is usually very high, but the good thing is you would do 3 quizzes and count only the best 2.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too heavy, just keep updated with the slides and the book, just prepare the group projects very well

reviews.author: uster_000
reviews.comment_content: Quite easy compared to other courses. The mid-terms are all in MC format and it is not really hard if you can remember the content well.
reviews.comment_teaching: He prefers a vivid and interactive class than a pure-duck-feeding class, so it is definitely more beneficial for you to answer questions more often. One more thing, he could recognise every single one of the students and so don't try to escape class because he attaches much importance on the attendance.
reviews.comment_grading: It depends much on your group performance and your mid-team results. So try to form a good team and perform well in a group-based even when you are having the class.
reviews.comment_workload: Not really that heavy out-of-class but other professors' class have even less workload than him. And there is no final examination which can really lessen much burden.

reviews.author: kayyangrace
reviews.title: Very good grade
reviews.comment_content: Easy content and you can always understand the notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Kim is a good professor though he is quite serious. Never skip class as he always tests the things that he mentioned in class. He wants interactions and feedback from students so if you answer more questions in class, the participating score must be good.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolutely good grade. All groupmates got A range finally.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 midterms, one case study, one group project but without final. Not so heavy workload because I think I really enjoy this course. All midterms are MCQ.

reviews.author: chuang
reviews.comment_content: The slides were very good and highlighted all the keypoints. However, it is still very important to attend lectures, as the professor will mention examples that are not on the slides. Very often, these examples will appear on the quizzes. Overall, it provided a good introduction to marketing for me.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's teaching was clear and easy to understand, and he's very helpful and willing to spend time to answer questions until the students understand everything. Various mediums were used in the lessons to allow students to better grasp the concepts, e.g. films, advertisements, case studies. Also, the professor has a great sense of humour, so that made the lessons fun. Overall the lessons were very engaging.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. The grading distribution for the assignments, quizzes, group project made sense. It should be noted that the professor places heavy emphasis on participation, so it is important to take part in discussions, answer questions, be punctual, etc.  Participation definitely made a big difference to the final grade, especially because the quizzes are not very difficult. A lack of participation may even result in grade deductions.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was adequate. The quizzes were not difficult to study for, as long as you are willing to spend time to write a detailed cheat sheet. This was the only lecture that had a final, but overall, the total amount of quizzes is still the same as the other lectures, 3 quizzes in total. The group project was slightly more time- consuming. But it was a fun project, and it's manageable if you have good group members.

reviews.author: 7s4w
reviews.comment_content: This is mainly an introductory course for Marketing. As I think Marketing is a popular choice besides Finance and Accounting, many students registered for popular professors. As I was allocated to register classes at 3pm, this is almost the last option that I could get. The content covers almost the whole book for 10+ chapters. In my opinion, I do not think that you need to buy the book, as the previous versions are just similar to the latest one, except that the examples and design might be different. The publisher will have a new edition every year, but I think it's a total waste to buy a new book, as you can always borrow the older versions in the library.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a visiting professor from the University of Hong Kong. He said in the first lesson that as he knew that HKUST is famous for having bright students, he wanted to teach in HKUST to see the learning atmosphere here. He is very engaging, which I like it. During the first lesson, he asked everyone to introduce themselves. In the second lesson, he could already remember most of the names. The lessons lasted for 3 hours once a week with a break in between. I like this better as I can often endure long lessons. He often asked questions to students, especially those who didn't pay attention in class according to my observation.
reviews.comment_grading: It is very easy to estimate the grading, as the weightings were clearly. The final grade I got was exactly the same when I estimated my grade after all the finals. Personally, I do not think that it's hard to predict the participation grade because I answered more than once in every class. Also, you should go to the class because he can definitely know whether you went to that class or not.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think in general the workload is very light. It's because I got very good project mates.

2 quizzes (ie mid-term) - all multiple choice, 20% each, the higher one will be weighted higher)
1 case analysis - 12%
1 marketing plan - 20%
Class participation (individual) - 5%
In-class activities (team-based) - 20%
Experiment: 3%

reviews.author: saelimo
reviews.title: fun but heavy workload
reviews.comment_content: Interesting but a lot to cover. Within a month, we've covered more than 10chapters and professor recommended us to read the chapters.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very engaging. However, it's very hard to predict the participation grade because it seems to be very subjective. Also, you should go to the class. He randomly gives pop quizzes. Within a month, I had 2 pop quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading: During the second class of the course, he mentioned that he would probably give 20% of As. He tries to be nice when grading assignments
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload due to the reports, presentation and the final exam within 3 days. The guideline is very unorganized. You have to build up your own guideline to work on the project. Also, the report is only 8pages with 1.5 space. You have a lot of write in limited space.

reviews.author: Sophsoph
reviews.title: Best marketing course I've ever had.
reviews.comment_content: A bit fluffy content by the nature of marketing but the professor plans it very systematically. You learn quite a lot of theories and useful equations. Prof also has good background in economics.
reviews.comment_teaching: I never dosed off in this prof's class. It's so fun, engaging, and very interesting. The professor never makes it competitive for students to class participate - everything is natural and the class is generally very nice. It's important for everyone not to make the class very tight to compete with class participation.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is subjective. The professor gives quality feedback on the details of the work, and also gives ideas on improvement. The prof does not give out easy A's but at the same time, when you do you work and deserve a good grade, he gives it to you. A lot of pop quizses though.
reviews.comment_workload: Not so much workload. Two written tests, one report, one presentation, and another report for the group project. The project didn't take as much time as I expected. It took way less time than a marketing project I did at a different school. Quite manageable workload, fun too. Just plan ahead.

reviews.author: MM
reviews.title: Good professor but bad grading!!
reviews.comment_content:
MARK 2120 is the introductory course of marketing. In the whole course, you will learn basic marketing concepts and knowledge.

For Wenbo classes, in the first lesson you will be given a summary of what you will be learning in the whole semester. After that, materials will be elaborated more clearly, mostly focuses on 4Ps (Product, Price, Promotion and Position) and 3Cs (Customer, Company and Competition).   

Wenbo does not require you to use textbook, you only need to use his PPTs and it would be fine. For his PPTs, it is quite clear and not much to momorize, most of the time he will use case to elaborate the concepts and ideas, you will just need to listen what he said and have a brief understanding than it would be fine for your quiz.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, Wenbo is also one of my most favorite Professor. He is funny and always make jokes. Personally I really learn a lot in his class and found marketing interesting. He is good at using case studies to elaborate ideas and concepts, his class is relax and not demanding.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say not good as I expected.

In the course, you have 3-quiz and count the best 2 (All are in MCs format).

Tips: For the second and third quiz, Wenbo will have 1 question about optional reading for bonus (which is absolute grading, independent for the quiz) and 1 question about group project (very easy as he just ask you to write down your project name to prove you are not freeride and know what your group is doing)

I say bad grade because I got full mark for quiz one and above 1 sd for quiz 2. Quiz 3 result didn't announce. I get full make in research (You need to participate 3 research study). But I got B+ only. I guess the marks is very competitive and you need to answer questions in class, project mark may also affect your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much in the first half of the course, Wenbo does not have HWs and what you need is to spend some time to do revision for quiz (Only read his PPTs would give you good result).
However, you need to have marketing puzzles and marketing presentation after first half of the course (Two presentation and 1 final report). Yo may need some time to meet up with groupmates to discuss.

reviews.author: Roddie
reviews.title: Interesting Course
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite interesting, especially the puzzle discussed in the class, which is quite counter-intuitive, and while having the discussion about the rationale behind these phenomenon, many creative ideas were developed. Personally speaking, the most interesting thing in the class is about the puzzle. The content about marketing is quite practical and can be frequently used in our daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wenbo's class is quite interesting, he frequently used some real life example to explain the marketing knowledge. And the puzzles that discussed in the class can trigger your interest. Before having the class, he generally plays some interesting advertisement, within the class, he will use these kind of ads to explain the marketing knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading: Hmmmm, personally speaking the grade is not as good as I expected, since at least I got above mean in the quiz, and quite good result and feedback from the presentation and group project. Actively respond to the questions asked by the prof. I think the reason I did not get into A-range is becoz my quizzie is not good enough (The mean is so high).
reviews.comment_workload: Admittedly, the workload is quite high, since there are two presentation and two group project. Three quizzes, despite only the highest two of them will be counted. Three marketing experiment is quite time-consuming, but it is compulsory, hence, the workload is large. Especially two presentation and two group project(in fact, one is group puzzle, but it is basically the same, the workload of the group puzzle is less than the group project.)

reviews.author: Avocado
reviews.title: Good, and interesting course.
reviews.comment_content: This course is an introduction to marketing management, and the topics covered include STP, 4Ps, 3Cs and the marketing process. The content is quite easy to understand, especially if you do the assigned readings before the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Amy is a very good teacher, and it is very easy to understand her (obviously) as her English is really good. Although many people say she's a 'killer prof', I personally don't think she was very strict or tough. However, she DOES really hate it if you talk during class (when she's lecturing) or you use your phone. She's really friendly, and willing to answer your questions if necessary.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 3 quizzes, and a group project (includes in-class assignments, a case study, and a marketing plan) that count towards your final grade. For the quizzes, only the two highest scores will be taken into account for your final grade (so if you think you've done well on the first two, you can actually skip the last one, although this isn't recommended). There is no final exam for Prof. Dalton's section.

In terms of my grade, I got an A+ overall.

I got 1 SD above mean for both quizzes (24/25) and our group in-class assignments, case study and marketing plan were either around mean or above mean consistently. However, the peer review marks DO affect your individual score (can bring it up or down) so don't free ride if you want a good grade. Attendance is compulsory during the four presentation lessons towards the end of the semester.
reviews.comment_workload: Amy expects you to do the assigned readings before each class (usually like 5-10 pages), which won't take you too long. In terms of the group project, you're allowed to form your own groups, so don't work with free-riders! The majority of the workload is from the Clocky case study and the Marketing Plan at the end of the semester, and to do a good job, you'll have to put in a lot of effort. As there are peer reviews, don't slack off because a bad peer review means your individual grade will be decreased.

reviews.author: LeoLibra107
reviews.title: Good Professor Bad Grading
reviews.comment_content:
Basically the entry level marketing knowledge - 3Cs, STP and 4Ps. Learning how to analysis all these is actually quite fun.

It is important to get a textbook (buy / borrow / e-book or whatever). The information on the power points might not be sufficient for quiz preparation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Dalton is good in teaching. You would hardly fall asleep in her class. It's okay to ask her any questions regarding to the course, she will answer promptly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz                     - 40% (best 2 out of 3 quizzes)
Clocky case         - 12%
Marketing Plan    - 20%
In-class activities - 20%
Markexp               - 3%
Participation         - 5%

I scored lower than mean for my quizzes, around 1% lower but higher for all the other components (my group did quite well, we got 12/12 for the clocky case). The sum according to CANVAS is 89% for my total marks after all results are disclosed but I only got a B+ but some classmates with similar scores get A instead.

I emailed the TA regarding this issue and he says I am only 78.6 percentile in the all three session and low quizzes mark could be the reason. The only possibility I could relate is that my adjusted mark after peer evaluation is much lower than the one reflected. I don't know how this could happen but there's nothing much I can do so I can only suck it up ._.

The lesson is score as high as possible for all the components :/
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair, all group activities are done in class. Marketing plan might take up more time especially near to the end of semester.

reviews.comment_workload:

1 Puzzle case in Group (need to present + 2 pages proposal)
1 Final Group Project (12 pages report + presentation)

reviews.author: thettjess
reviews.title: Interesting content, boring class
reviews.comment_content:
The Content of marketing is actually interesting since unlike economics or  finance, we are able to relate marketing theory to real life situation, which is more fun. However, there are not a lot of content. For the whole course, it covers the following:
3Cs: Customer, Company, Competition
STP: Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning
4Ps: Price, Product, Place, Promotion

Since it does not take long to teach all of these content, quite a huge amount of time are used for marketing puzzle presentation and break time (10 minutes for each lesson)....
reviews.comment_teaching: Shi Yang is a new teacher and she does not know how to handle students. The class is usually noisy and even worse, she is not even good at teaching marketing concepts. She gives out bad examples and quite misleading. However, she is quite nice and helpful. She is willing to improve in which I hopes that she will be a better professor in the future
reviews.comment_grading:
Best 2 Quizzes 25% each
Final Project Report (group work) 18%
Final Project Presentation (group work) 9%
Marketing Puzzle (5%) + Presentation (5%) (group work) 10%
In-Class Group Exercises (group work) 5%
Class Participation +/- 5%
Research Participation 3%

I do not know my presentation mark since it is not released. For the quizzes, I got 1 quiz full mark and another quiz above mean 1 mark. I got mean in puzzle and final project.
I got B+ ultimately which I am quite satisfied since I kinda messed up in the final project. One Tip: do answer Shi Yang questions and actively participate in class. Usually no one respond to her since her teaching is quite boring. But if she remembers you, you may probably get a good grade!
reviews.comment_workload:
I won't say that the workload is heavy since the lessons are quite "hea".

Quiz:only 2 out of 3 quiz will be accounted into your final grade. The quiz are quite easy as long as you study all the slides. But remember, the answers are based on the assumptions Shi Yang set in class, so do not tend to over think!

Marketing Puzzle: You have to hand in a 2 page report and prepare a simple presentation. Just find a simple topic and work on it. Our group finished the puzzle within 3 hrs.....

Marketing Project; choose a service or product to promote it in HK. Do spend more time in the final project since it accounts quite a lot of marks.

Research Participation: sign up for marketing research and spend 3 hours to finish 3 boring research......

Class participation: Well, go to class

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.title: Heavy workload
reviews.comment_content:
Basic marketing knowledge
Understand the Market (3Cs)
STP
4Ps
Clocky Case

Most of the contents are not difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is a new professor, she has just graduated and we are the first batch of students of hers. Basically, you can't get much from this professor, maybe she will improve.

First, her presentation has a large room for improvement, it is difficult for you to understand what she is talking about. She has strong mainland accent which makes her presentation even more difficult to understand. To be honest, only a few students will listen to her in class.

Second, don't find her for consultation during the assigned timeslots(2 times theoughout the semester, 10 minutes each), she will confuse you and being confused by you, then she will keep agreeing with you, but I heard that turns out she was not satisfied by what she approved. Finding her after class or office hours makes more sense.

However, she is quite willing to improve, obviously the lessons are easier for us to catch up and understand at the last stage of the course.

One more thing, she tends to add some economics and mathematics knowledge in the course, which are not covered in other lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not the grade in SIS but in Canvas, may not be finalised.

Based on this grade, the grading is good. She gives similar marks in the final project, so quizzes will be important, mean of quizzes are usually high as the quizzes are easy, if you can really read and memorize all the slides, and attend lessons, you can easily get above mean.

I got extremely low marks in marketing puzzle, nearly full marks in quizzes (I skipped one quiz), above mean for project.

Overall marks 9X% will give you an A range grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy, but the workload for this professor's lecture is lighter already.

We have 3 quizzes in total (count best 2), which were extremely easy, questions were copied directly from the slides.

We had something called marketing puzzle which we needed to find a puzzling marketing strategy and investigate in it. This is the most horrible part in the course. It is really hard to find a strategy that is easy to illustrate and can satisfy her fully.

Lastly, the marketing project, she tends to give similar marks to all groups. One point to get a better grade: try to find special/new/luxury goods for your project.

Our clocky case was just counted as inclass group exercise, however, some lectures counted these seperately and it takes up 1x% of the course grade for them. The case is very long if you need to understand it fully.

reviews.author: Megan
reviews.title: Marketing
reviews.comment_content: His class is fun and enjoyable, won't be bored of his lesson because he'll always try to get someone to answer some of his questions. Instead of finals, there were quizzes that had MCQ, open ended questions and a short essay question where a scenario would be given to answer with.
reviews.comment_teaching: A really chill professor that gives good real life examples to be used to compare with and explains the theory pretty well so it's easy to understand. Didn't have to read too much from textbook but just a bit to further fully understand the concepts, which help out for the quizzes. Attendance is quite important (10% + pop quizzes) in his class as he makes everyone sign the sheet before class and if he remembers your name. It also benefits because 10% is class participation so try to voice out as much as you can and 10% is yours.
reviews.comment_grading: Personally I think that he's a good grader but depends on other groups as most of the people in the summer class was an exchange student with Marketing background so it will be a benefit to work in a group with them.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much, just 1 observational research paper, a group of 6 marketing plan including a written report and oral presentation. He doesn't give any other assignments or much readings but there are some case studies that relate back to the course.

reviews.author: Elissa
reviews.comment_content: This was my first marketing class in UST. Class was fun, materials were insightful and we had fun cases, group projects and presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching: One of my most favorite Professor. He made the classes fun, engaging and memorable, with insightful case studies, and was very helpful to students questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Marketing major has competitive grading. Make sure to aim above 90% for your quizzes or as high as possible! Everyone could get good grade, and with this curve grading, even though you have good score for exams, quizzes and projects, it is easy to fall behind. Participation helps too! Do your very best and enjoy the class! :)
reviews.comment_workload: As usual of Marketing courses, heavy workload. Case studies, discussions, projects, presentation and quiz. Come prepared for class! Regardless of the heavy workload, personally I had fun and learnt a lot.

reviews.comment_grading: If you mess up anything, chances are that your grades will reflect that rather heavily. There were three quizzes, consisting completely of multiple choice questions.
reviews.comment_workload: Occasional assignments, both in-class and out-of-class. Hence, attendance is also quite important.

Been studying hard and only got 1 question wrong on each of my quizzes (ok the mean was getting 3 questions wrong), but I got C+. I found that very ridiculous cos after asking her and the TA about it they just gave me a detailed analysis of my grade and they obviously gave me a wrong mark on my quizzes. They wouldn't listen to me but whatever I would just move on.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fine. Just make sure you hv good teammates.

reviews.title: Participate More
reviews.comment_content: She will teach lots of content out of syllabus but if you pay attention well, you get lots of takeaways.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very interactive class and you get to watch ads videos, with lots of real-life examples included in her explanation.
reviews.comment_grading: Depends, think the key is to participate more in order to earn credits. Final is a bit weird since it requires you to watch a video and write a 300-word essay, and questions are not formal and included in the syllabus.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair, she requires you to do readings before class but she never asks about it. But it will be included in the final exam.

reviews.author: noidea
reviews.comment_content:
3Cs (consumer, company, competitor)
STP (segmentation, targeting, positioning)
4Ps (product, price, place, promotion)
Platform strategy
reviews.comment_teaching:
June teaches the concepts clearly and uses lots of examples to clarify the concepts.
She tried her best to let us answer questions to get participation marks in every class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes 25% + 25% (best 2 out of 3 count towards the grade)
Case assignment 5%
Final project report 22%
Final project presentation15%
Group class participation 5%
Research credit 3%
Individual class participation +/-10%

The grading is super lenient. I was expecting a B range, but got an A eventually.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low as most of the workload comes from the project and quizzes.

reviews.author: kiWikiWi
reviews.title: A course Friendly to Extroverts/Question Raisers
reviews.comment_content:
Basic marketing principles :3Cs, STP(Segment, Targeting, Positioning), 4Ps.

Most contents are easy and understandable. Some talks and videos will be played during lessons and they are part of the syllabus. Coral would include them in the final quiz thus pay attention to that. Not much memorization is required.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Coral has quite a thick accent and tends to talk about some slang thus it's sometimes hard to catch up on her teaching if you are not a good listener. Nonetheless, it is fruitful to attend the lessons as she shares numerous advertisements as examples and fun videos. She is also chill and easy to get along with. Coral would give positive feedback and encouragement during presentations and participation in class, almost all groups receive "GJ/excellent/well-done".

Some reviews mention she cares about foreign students more than locals, umm she did like to chat with foreign students more frequently and ask if they fit in UST, but the grading is fair. I don't see any significant discrimination.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair (and quite lenient I would say?)

Quiz 35% (one quiz, MC + 1 EssayQ) [mean: 34.66/50]
Marketing Plan (Group Project) 32% [mean: 7/10]
In-class participation 10%
2 Topic essays of 250-300 words 15%
In-class Activity 5%
Research Credit 3%

For essay, it's just a short piece of writing within 300 words, like posting tweets, 90% of people get full marks for all essays so don't worry ;)

Participation is CRITICAL.
I got 38/50 for the final quiz, and UQ is 40 sth.
For the group project, we touch the UQ while most groups get high marks too. But I did participate quite a lot and let her remember my NAME without referring to the name cardü•πFinally got an A !!!

Remember that she likes people to speak out in class but it will be hard to have chances if you wait for her to ask questions (she would forget to raise questions as she is sometimes too focused on teaching/elaborating). Try to ask questions by yourself instead of being the answerer!
reviews.comment_workload:
Relatively low.
Two essays, one project and one final quiz. She would give time for us to discuss and work on projects and she allows notecards in the present so it has a quite low workload. Essay assignments are short and easy, and it is quite free as you can choose any topic we learnt before.

reviews.author: FannyFan
reviews.comment_content: Mainly those Cs and Ps, are not difficult to handle. but understanding is the most important. Also, I learned a lot from the two guest speakers. It is rare that a course can invite two.
reviews.comment_teaching: Many people say she is not good but actually, she is quite nice. Just enjoy and feel free to interact with her. She loves interacting with students. I think this would help to create a good impression too. She is willing to answer questions and discuss various issues with students.
reviews.comment_grading:
There is no doubt that you can really feel that everyone in the class is competitive. Every team's project is insightful and fantastic. Therefore, for some minor things like attendance, in-class participation and the essay, please try your best to get them all.
I would say the project and final quiz are significant. Just try your best in the quiz.
I am quite worried about my grade at first, but end up A+ yeah.
reviews.comment_workload:
Because of the summer course schedule, things are quite packed. But they are manageable since this is the only course I take this summer.  
There are reading materials, not for grading but will help you join the in-class discussion.
There is an essay of around 300 words max in which you have to apply one concept taught to a real-world situation or example in order to show your understanding. The marking follows a 3-points system.
There is also a final quiz, just some MCs and one final long question (~300words). They are straightforward, you can definitely perform well if you pay attention in class and understand the content.

reviews.author: Wqqpbzq
reviews.title: Interesting and relax, with a not so good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Marketing Management
3C

STP

You can absorb the class material through her class easily.She often asks questions in class and will listen to students' answers carefully. She also tries hard to remember every students' names~

The rest workload is the presentation. My group has no freeriders so there's only one week(before the presentation) needs extra effort.

reviews.author: Sylviaaaleee
reviews.title: Interesting course
reviews.comment_content: The content is mainly the basic marketing knowledge, not hard but interesting. I do found something related to my daily life!
reviews.comment_teaching: I love her! Really lovely professor! She is really nice, patient and interesting, and she said she would invite the best students in her class to DisneyLand (I was not invited sadly)
reviews.comment_grading:
Not good but not soooo bad: )
The 3 quizzes do matter !!! Remember to review what she said in the lecture or you would answer her questions!
reviews.comment_workload: Not so heavy work, only pay attention to the lecture~ Quizzes and projects only!

reviews.author: Z666
reviews.comment_content:
3Cs, STP and 4Ps
-some basic concepts of marketing
-you need to understand those concepts and applications instead of remembering them
reviews.comment_teaching:

reviews.author: Lko
reviews.title: Intro Course to Marketing
reviews.comment_content:
I'm a non-business major student and I find the content of this course easy to understand. General concepts of marketing and the structure of a marketing plan are introduced.

There is a required textbook and I accessed an older version of it through HKUST library for free. The context of the textbook is included in the quiz. During lectures, Prof never uses the textbook and teaches by PPTs and videos instead. For the project, it is important to follow the instructions on the lecture materials.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Coral's lectures are highly interactive and she encourages us to ask and answer questions all the time. She also uses a LOTTT of real-life examples and invites students to share their opinion on those examples. She also invited some guest lecturers who are experienced marketing professionals to speak to us.

One big problem is that she has a heavy accent and being a local student, I can only understand around half of what she said lmao Dont take her course if you cannot stand her accent!! U will suffer
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 30%
Marketing plan (group project) 20%
Peer evaluation 12%
Class Participation
- in-class participation 15%
- 2 topic essays of 200 words 20%
research credit 3%

I don't know the details of my grades since they were not released. I got an A- finally.
reviews.comment_workload:
A group project with a presentation, a quiz, some small assignments and class participation. The workload is fine for me since those small assignments did not take much time.
The group project is to create a marketing plan for an existing brand. Make sure your groupmates have common sense then it will be fine.
There is only one quiz and it was held in the last lesson so it's basically a final exam. The quiz has 30 MCQs and one essay question which is of one A4 page.
Class participation is also important. According to the TA, she gives you marks whenever you speaks in class. Coral remembers those who are active.

reviews.author: Alvin C
reviews.title: Good Instructor
reviews.comment_content:
Introductory course on marketing

Focus: framework and tools used in Marketing
Marketing Analysis: Understanding the marketing environment ‚Äú3Cs‚Äù
Marketing Strategy: Designing long-term marketing strategy ‚ÄúSTP‚Äù
Marketing Mix: Crafting out short-term marketing actions ‚Äú4Ps‚Äù
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is quite nice and very engaging. She encourages students to try to answer questions even if their answer may not be completely correct. She is nice and willing to help students with their problems.
reviews.comment_grading:
Best 2 quizzes from 3 quizzes (25% each) + Final Project Report (group work) (27%) + Final Project Presentation (group work) (15%) + Group Exercise (group work) (5%) + Research Credit (individual work) (3%) + Individual Class Participation (individual work) (+/- 10% )

Good grading overall
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is ok, mostly comes from the group project which can take a bit of time to think about the product you want to market.

reviews.author: Sanford
reviews.comment_content: It was eye-opening topics, materials and discussion and the prof was able to deliver it well. which made the class sessions that much more interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof was nice, inclusive and encouraging class discussion at its best. She was able to make a great remark especially on us as freshmen.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite lenient. work smart and ask when you don't understand something. The prof will give clear outline of where the course is heading and make sure to pay attention to that. Group work will be fun if you manage to get a good teammates.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is not bad, there isn't any stress or extensive

reviews.author: lalu
reviews.title: it was a good course overall
reviews.comment_content: the content consists of: Company and marketing strategy I, Understanding Customer Behaviors I/II, 4Ps (price, place,promotion, product) and etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sophie (she insists to call her by her name, instead of calling her professor :D) was so sweet and encouraging.

I loved being in her lecture because she creates a positive atmosphere. Although I do think she could be a little more clear when she is delivering lecture at times..

Overall I enjoyed her lectures!!
reviews.comment_grading: I think grading was okay, but mean was always high so not really scoring.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not too bad. The 3 quizzes (20/25 MCQs) were a bit challenging because the mean was usually high.

I liked that there is no final exam.

The group project was to develop our own marketing plan for a product/service we wish to create. This semester because it was via zoom, we couldn't choose our group members..

reviews.author: k309281
reviews.title: Thought of
reviews.comment_content:
Materials covered are:
3Cs (Consumer, Company, Competitor)
STP (Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning)
4Ps(Product, Price, Promotion, Place)

Content-wise, it was easy to understand. The ppt itself is quite straightforward, but to gain a better understanding you need to be awake in lecture time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The materials Wenbo brought to the class were quite interesting, especially the real-life examples he had given.

His teaching was quite interactive as he showed many advertisement videos illustrating his points.

He liked to point out the materials covered in the quiz, and some of the quiz questions were the same with the practice, which made the quiz not that hard, but it dragged the mean high up. Ugh.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading sucks.

Percentage of grading:
1) Quizzes (individual work)  25% each
2) Final Project Report (group work) 27%
3) Final Project Presentation (group work) 27%
4) Research Credit (individual work) 3%
5) In-Class Group Case Discussion and Exercise 10%
6) Participation +/-10%

My grades:
Quiz 1: 95/100, mean: 93/100
Quiz 2: 88/100, mean: 88/100
Quiz 3: 70/100, mean: 81/100
Research: 3/3
Project, Discussion, Participation: N/A

The quizzes were mostly about the application of the theories.

There was quite a lot of chance of participation. I participated 2 or 3 times, and usually, the queue was quite long, so you need to be fast to raise your hand, especially in zoom.

Overall grade: C+
At the beginning of the class, he said he would be lenient with the grading, but I guess it's not for everyone.
Worst of my grades. Bye to my GPA :')
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fine; there will be three quizzes throughout the semester, which is quite spread out during the semester. Always pay attention to class; it will save your revision time.

There are readings from Wenbo, but the only required one was the IKEA Case, there were some questions that you need to answer to boost the team project score..

Find a good teammate for the group project! Each team consisted of 7 people, so it does not carry a big workload.

Overall, the workload of the course is manageable.

reviews.author: Ë•øË¥ù
reviews.title: Sweetest teacher ever in HKUST!
reviews.comment_content:
Many theoretical concepts about marketing.
Almost no calculation is needed.
As a Science student in senior high, I am really not capable of handling this course. But my Art friends found this course interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Damn Sophie is sooooooo cute! She is doing everything she can to keep the lecture interesting interactive and smooth. (not quite effective due to the essence of the course tho)
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair. Not so good, not so bad.
But the exam is so disgusting. Multiple choice with the unknown number of the right answer, and in Sophie's class you can't resort to your teammate.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy at all. No homework, no after-class quiz. Only a group project to let your team promote something you decide. However, in Sophie's class, the team is randomly allocated so when not having fortune you may be assigned some free-riders that drive you crazy.

reviews.author: kniu
reviews.title: Informative and interesting course. Brilliant professor.
reviews.comment_content:
In this course, you will be introduced to the principles underlying these activities and given
opportunities to try your hand at analyzing markets and formulating strategy. The more specific
objectives are:
‚Ä¢ To acquire an understanding of basic marketing concepts.
‚Ä¢ To understand the strategic role of marketing.
‚Ä¢ To gain an understanding of the elements of the marketing mix and their interaction.
‚Ä¢ To identify and address the key decisions facing marketing managers.
‚Ä¢ To practice the process of analyzing a marketing situation or opportunity, formulating market
strategy, and developing and implementing a marketing plan.
‚Ä¢ To integrate marketing knowledge with other areas in business.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sophie is the most energetic professor I have seen in UST. Her teaching style is quite engaging.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade components and the associated weights are as follow:
1) Best 2 Quizzes (individual work) 25% each
2) Final Project Report (group work) 27%
3) Final Project Presentation (group work) 15%
4) Group Exercise (group work) 5%
6) Research Credit (individual work) 3%
7) Individual Class Participation (individual work) +/- 10%
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fairly low. But freeriders might be encountered in group project.

reviews.author: Bai
reviews.comment_content:
3C - Consumers, Company, Competitor
STP - Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning
4P - Product, Price, Place, Promotion
Everything is easy and straightforward.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Frankly speaking, his teaching was not bad.
You can find most content in the ppt but I would suggest attending his lecture. There are videos provided during the lecture and he will ask some questions. If you want to get a higher grade, do answer his question to get the bonus point.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes 25% each ( best 2 out of 3)
Final Project Report 27%
Final Project Presentation 10%
Research Credit 3%
In-class Group Case Discussion and Exercise 10%
Participation (bonus +/- 10%)

2 Quiz (out of 3) count for 50%, make sure you can get at least 90% on each quiz since the quiz is very easy. you can find most answers in the ppt so everyone can get every high score.

Since everyone got the first 50% from the quiz, your grade really depends on the project score and participation in class. However, the scores on these two parts were not disclosed.
reviews.comment_workload:
Average workload„ÄÄ
3 open book Quiz with sample quizzes provide
Question asked in the sample quiz will also be asked in the quiz
1 group project (final report + presentation)
3% research credit

reviews.author: ypoons9
reviews.title: Don't trust him. He is a liar.
reviews.comment_content:
Some basic marketing concepts
3C
STP
4P

Easy and straightforward, not much can learn from.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wenbo's teaching is quite good. The class is interactive. Sometimes he tells jokes (usually are blue jokes lol) to entertain the class. Also, he usually finishes the lecture early and let us go.

HOWEVER,
please please please don't trust everything he says.
He has been telling us his grading would be super lenient throughout the semester. It turns out to be a big lie!! He also said he has some power in the department to make our grades better. Yet, DON'T TRUST HIM. He only gave 20% A range where 25% is the maximum.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes 25% each (count the best 2 out of 3)
Final Project Report 27%
Final Project Presentation 10%
Research Credit 3%
In-class Group Case Discussion and Exercise 10%
Participation (bonus +/- 10%)

My result:
Quizzes: 100/100, 98/100
Research credit: full
Others: not disclosed
Grade: C+

I only answered his question for 4 times. I have been raising my hands but he rarely calls my name. He only pays attention to a few guys.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that heavy.

3 quizzes. Each quiz lasts for one hour. They are easy to handle. All questions are MCs only. Most people can finish within 30mins.

There are 2 bonus questions in quiz2, asking what is your group name and what question is your group responsible for the case discussion.

The final project and case discussion are not difficult to handle. 7-8 people in a group. Make sure your idea is interesting and have a consultation with that liar. I guess he likes sex-related ideas. Also, don't act like reading aloud during the presentation. Try to make it vivid such as asking the audience to imagine and making some laughing points. Asking 1-2 questions to the audience is also good. The liar likes these things.

reviews.author: 17lambj1
reviews.comment_content: Went through the basics of marketing: 3C's, STP and 4P's. May skip some small, unimportant elements if she's short on time. Relatively easily memorizable content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is very strict but as long as you appeal to her it is okay. Just contribute in class (with useful information, not just randomly speaking) so that she remembers you and simply do your work and follow her instructions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was strict/harsh but fair. E.g for her marketing quizzes, she says it's meant to be subjective but it's really not. Just memorize and note down everything she mentions in class and aggressively take notes. Then just repeat it in the quiz paper. Nothing creative about it, just memorize and repeat it on your exam.

Best 2 out of 3 quizzes
Group presentation
Group report
In-class exercises
Additional participation marks
reviews.comment_workload: Workload isn't that high but depends on your group mates. For this semester, we couldn't choose our group mates (online sem) and she probably will not let you choose for next semester too. This really depends on luck. If you have bad group mates you'll end up doing a lot so be careful.

reviews.author: Stephen Chow
reviews.title: Enjoyable Zoom class
reviews.comment_content:
3Cs: Consumer, competitors, company
STP
Marketing Research
4Ps
Platform strategies

Concepts are easy to understand. For students who took DSE BAFS/ Economics, you may be of greater advantage because some concepts are relatable
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Shi is very nice. She is willing to answer every question raised by students. You can either email her or private message her via the Zoom chatbox. Her replies are quite prompt!

The layouts of the ppts are very clear and it's good for revision. However, sometimes you may find the concepts a bit confusing (like those involve calculation). You have to pay extra attention to those parts and I think they are the most tricky items throughout the whole course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair but it's competitive.
Participation is very important if you're lucky enough, you gonna encounter a group of enthusiastic classmates like me... Grab every chance to speak up!

1. 3 Quizzes (Non-cumulative)~ high mean (only take the 2 highest ones into account)
2. No exams
3. Group project
4. Group presentation (your mark is depended on both the prof and your classmates' evaluation)

PS: some questions in the quizzes are pretty subjective.
reviews.comment_workload:
Syllabus for the 3 quizzes is manageable.

Group project: Depends on whether you have a team of good quality groupmates. If they do contribute towards the project, the workload is acceptable.

Group presentation: Only need to choose 1-2 people from your group to do the presentation.

No assignments and final exams.

reviews.author: ÁßëÂ§ßÂ≠∏Áîü
reviews.title: Unexpected good grade
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is easy to catch up as it is not too hard. The concept is quite clear and easy to understand. It covers some basic marketing concept and it is quite interesting and not that boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes he makes some jokes and shows some interesting videos to make the class more interesting. But it is easy to fall asleep in his class when he is teaching the theory. Overall, he made the concept quite clear for us to understand. He requires a lot of interactions in the class so answering questions is very important in his class.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A though I was not really responsive in answering his question. I got above mean in the quiz. I don't have the result of my group project.
reviews.comment_workload: The workout is just fair with the group presentation and some case studies. The quiz doesn't need much study but more requires your thinking and attention in the class. There are a few case studies that require you to read it at home .

reviews.author: Stellaaaa
reviews.comment_content:
Cant remember exactly what the content was because it's been a year since i took his course. Only writing this because i'm surprised to see he's only a B-range professor in UST space!
For those who are still hesitating, you won't regret if you sign up for this course.
But 1) you need to be interested in marketing; 2) you are willing to interact & contribute in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
By far my favorite professor in UST.
Lots of interactions.
Things learned in this course have changed the way i think.
I would say in most courses, I learn for better grades in exams, but in this course, i am actually learning things that are applicable in life.
reviews.comment_grading:
Honestly i wouldn't mind even if i don't get a good grade because I've learnt so much in this course.
But i was happy with my A- in the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Honestly i don't think it was a lot. Only need to prepare for quizzes and one project, which could be fun if you can come up with interesting ideas .

-quizzes & final
-project & presentation

reviews.title: Sophie is so nice

stp

reviews.author: lolxdd
reviews.comment_content:
marketing stuff

sth like this
