reviews.author: ET00
reviews.comment_content: 3C, STP, 4P
reviews.comment_teaching: Class discussion is encouraged and relative videos will be played for teaching, which is quite interesting. Mobile phones and chatting are not allowed during lectures, but her suitable pace of teaching rationalizes these class norms.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 quizzes almost above 1 sd
presentation grade unknown, but according to her comments she should like our idea
tbh our presentation skills were so-so
I got A-
reviews.comment_workload: 3 quizzes might sound deterring, but the quizzes are not just about recitation. It includes examples used in the lectures too. Final presentation replaced the exam. So basically very light workload.

reviews.author: hoilammx
reviews.comment_content: An introductory course to marketing, relatively easy and interesting content compare to other courses, as it is related to our daily lives.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a very friendly and fun professor, her classes are never boring, as she will show videos and tell jokes in class. She will put less time in topics that she thinks boring e.g. pricing but you do not have to worry, as the quizzes will only test on the content that she taught in class.
reviews.comment_grading: She does not take attendance, but she takes class participation very heavily, so if you want to get good grades, all you have to do is be active in class and MAKE SURE SHE REMEMBERS YOU then you have nothing to worry.
reviews.comment_workload: The main workload comes from the group project, but she will let you work on the project during class time, so as long as you attend the class and have normal group mates, you do not have to worry about your project. The quizzes are all mc and only cover the content taught in class so no need to spend a lot of time in revision.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
1. Overview of Marketing
2. Consumer, Company, Competitor
3. Segmenting, Targeting, Positioning
[Quiz 1]

4. Marketing Research
5. Product
[Quiz 2]

6. Price
7. Place

9. Integrated Marketing

[Quiz 3]

reviews.comment_teaching: He is super funny and always plays a lot of videos (advertisement) in class which definitely arouse our willingness to learn. He is nice and willing to answer your questions in class or after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Hm.... I think he is not that lenient in giving grade I would say. Although he showed us how will he give the grades, I don't think it is that true tbh. Since he only announces the quiz marks and that's it, I cannot know how good or how bad I did in other aspects. Quite intransparent grading system.

GRADE:
50% 2 out of 3 Best Quizzes
27% Final Project Report: unknown
10% Final Project Presentation: unknown
10% Group Exercise: unknown
3% Research Credit: 3/3
+/-10% Individual Class Participation: unkown

Quiz 1: 80/100 (Mean: 83)
Quiz 2: 88/100 (Mean: 71, SD: 15)
Quiz 3: 76/100 (Mean: 72)

Final Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
Some works to do.

There will be some case studies and discussed in class which counted as Individual Participation. You have to answer as many as you can since many students will raise their hands and answer the questions as well. If you fail to answer, then you plan to get poor grade in this course.

There will be also a group case studies and counted as Group Exercise. You don't need to answer the questions for group exercise in order to gain mark. You just need to sit there is fine.

Project fine (if you have good groupmate)

reviews.author: Balloon
reviews.title: GPA Killer
reviews.comment_content:
basic marketing content that u can see from other reviews so im not gonna type those here.

you can learn good stuff from this prof in my opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
i would say is he VERY GOOD at teaching. Not boring(most of the time, coz i fell asleep a couple time lol), have a lot of videos, real-life examples that go with the class content.
He doesn't just read off the ppt like other prof does, he uses the ppt as a guide for teaching. attending class is definitely good (but u can still understand class materials from the ppt solely. FYI no lecture video)

Funny and humour. I would say he is quite nice and SUPER smart.
reviews.comment_grading:
Honestly, this prof does not give good grades at all:)
But in the first class, he will tell you that he gives out grade evenly according to the system and even give better grades compared to other profs that teach this class.

THAT'S A TOTAL HUGE LIE AND IM NOT JOKING.

for reference only: normally you can at a B if u get mean in most of the assignments/tests/works. HOWEVERRRR, it does not apply to this class. For this class, MEAN IS C RANGE:) No kidding. Avoid this prof if you want to secure your GPA:) Lmao coz it fked up mine:)
reviews.comment_workload:
3 tests
1 grp project(report+presentation)
3(i think) case reading

good grp mate is VERY important, you get to form your own group(6 ppl)

reviews.author: Tornado
reviews.title: Good course overall
reviews.comment_content: Basic marketing concepts. Manageable for everyone.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teacher talks about her personal life experiences in class to let us get more involved in class, which is actually a good thing because I got to clear concepts.

Prof. Puig is a very funny professor and she also understands the difficulties that students have.

Also, she focuses more on the practical side of marketing, not just the theory side.
reviews.comment_grading:
I can't be more happy to get A range.

Once you have finished the final test, did a good job in the marketing case study, as well as the group project, you have a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: We have the marketing case study, the group project and presentation, and have to study for final! That's quite some heavy workload in such a short period of time!

reviews.author: Sooooo
reviews.title: ‰∏ÄÂÄãËÅΩÂæóÂÖ•ËÄ≥Êó¢professor
reviews.comment_content:
The concepts for all MARK2120
Lectures are similar. It's the beginner level of marketing which is about some psychology and consumer behaviors. It is quite interesting to me.
Kim demonstrate quite a lot of example videos to illustrate the concepts so it is pretty interesting to take her lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kim's English is very fluent and she has much working experience in big companies so she is very good at illustrating the concepts in real life examples. I like her teaching quite a lot even though smartphone or laptop is prohibited in her class, it is because you don't actually need it in her class! I can pay more attention in her class than any other courses.
Kim is also very inspirational, when you seek for her comments on your project, she gives very concrete and useful comments and guide you to think deeper. You can really improve bit by bit through her comments.
reviews.comment_grading:
She clarified in the beginning of the semester that she gives 20% A, so the grading is fair.
25% quiz 1
25% quiz 2
25% quiz 3
(Count the best two)
25% group project
10% presentation
10% observational research exercise
3% research participation
2% in-class group exercise
+/- 5% class participation

She gave me A- for both the project and research exercise. I also above 1sd for both quizzes.
The final grade is A.
I think it's generally fair, but not particularly good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: All the MARK2120 course have similar workload, the project takes quite a lot of time and effort. For Kim, it is particularly important to attend every lesson as her quizzes heavily contented on her teaching materials only can be seen in class (ppt not completely uploaded), so you really can't skip lesson. However, if you pay attention in class, you don't have to revise much for the quzzes, so I guess it is still fair.

reviews.author: abcdef
reviews.title: SBMT2010
reviews.comment_content: Business ethics may sound boring to students, in fact, it is quite interesting since different cases push students to think more sbout historical and also modern ethical issues.

reviews.comment_grading: Although I don't actually know my final score, paying reasonable effort on the work will surely get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: We only need to do weekly discussion, 2 assignments and the final report(progress report included). Workload is definitely affordable.

reviews.author: NightShade
reviews.title: No comments
reviews.comment_content: it's got a book, some ppt notes (to supplement, not replace the book) and religious repetition of ppt (which probably hasn't and isn't going to be updated soon) during class. But of course, the videos are lovely and bring life to to class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Amazing enunciation (duh) and friendly to approach. But routine and conventional. No latest case study, no creativity and certainly no new material introduced.
reviews.comment_grading:
(Was new to SBM)
SD was minute. Mean was 80ish and grading criterion was incomprehensibly insane, so don't ask me.
Oh, and class participation and attendance - important!
reviews.comment_workload: Very interesting and enjoyable project work (Start up a startup). 2 projects. Horribly routine midterm and final quizzes that were based on your power of memorization (in short, boring). Fairly manageable workload.

reviews.title: Congrats if you are in Amy's class
reviews.comment_content:
easy concepts, I bet everyone can easily understand the content. Just make sure you don't get confused with the terms, make sure you understand all the terms then you'll be fine doing the quizzes.

Syllabus and Schedule are attached :)

Her lectures are very interactive too, you needa answer her questions to get yourself some impression mark. Trying your best to be active in class will definitely secure you a satisfactory grade.

reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is the best part of Sophie's class. It is very interactive. I would say I enjoy it a lot. You can feel her energy while teaching and her enthusiasm. Although other classmates don't really give much response to that (9 am class maybe?). I would suggest you definitely grasp this chance to at least answer 1-2 questions each class. Just to make the lesson less awkward sometimes and facilitate the discussion in some sense lmao.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are three quizzes in total, with 25 marks full each. Best 2 of the 3 quizzes score are selected.
Btw attendance is taken each class, you have to sign the paper in the first 15 minutes of the class!!

Quiz 1: 17/25, mean 15/25
Quiz 2: 20/25, mean 17/25
Quiz 3: 22/25, mean 18.5/25

Presentation and report mark are not released.

Final Grade: A+

So make sure you actively participate in class! Even I don't perform that well on the quiz, I can still get good grades!!! Sophie is KING (QUEEN?)
reviews.comment_workload:
No final, which is great. But the 3 quizzes definitely need some time for revision. Bear in mind that the quizzes are quite tricky and that you might easily get tricked. Unlike other MCs, her quizzes have no fixed amount of answers, you can select all 5 options in an MCQ. Make sure you understand the question and each answer thoroughly.

Sophie helped us by underlining some keywords and bold them, which helps in some sense, but in general... meh, some of the answers are still so ambiguous. Choosing one more option or one less would only grant you 0 marks. Also, make sure you watch/ attend all lessons of her class because many of the quizzes questions are from in-class discussions or points that are not typed in the slides.

Expect a heavy workload towards the end of the semester, when you have to finish 10 pages of the business plan report (using the 3Cs, 4Ps, and stuff), as well as 15-20 minutes of presentation. (Some free riders might also add some workload to it LOL)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Solid A for teaching and his personality.

Wenbo is such a funny dude. He is so chill during his lessons and tries his best to keep us entertained throughout the lesson with videos and telling us his personal experiences.

Some times the examples he uses are... interesting....

He teaches quite quickly, but can also end lessons early :)) One time our class was just 20 min lol
reviews.comment_grading:
1) Quizzes 25% each (Best 2 out of 3 counted)
2) Final Group Project Report 27%
3) Final Project Group Presentation 10%
4) Research Credit 3%
5) In-Class Group Case Discussion and Exercise 10%
6) Participation +/-10%

He said how he wanted to give as many A's as possible this semester and he'll be more lenient

Participation wise, it was kinda hard for you to answer his questions since like 70 people are fighting to answer the 1 or 2 questions he asks each lesson.

Overall Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that much, just make sure you pay attention in class since he strictly follows his powerpoint, so everything on the quiz will be based off that. Also listen closely to the examples he uses to describe any particular concept cuz a question in the quiz can literally just ask "which of the following examples have we discussed in class?"

Quizzes consist of 20 MCQs and you get an hour to complete them. They are pretty straightforward, they just require you to recall info.

The group project and presentation can require more effort and work. Try to be organised and not leave stuff to the last minute.

For the case study discussion, you just need to elaborate on one question he assigns to each group, shouldn't be too hard.
